<!-- COMMAND=ADD_LINERULETXT,NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="26%" ALIGN="LEFT" -->
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="26%" ALIGN="LEFT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:15%;">
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(1)
</FONT>
</DT>
</EFX_OPTIONS>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	At
	the time of the option grants on October&nbsp;10, 2014, management determined that the fair value of our Class&nbsp;A membership units of $7.00 per
	unit calculated in the valuation as of May&nbsp;31, 2014 reasonably reflected the per unit fair value of Class&nbsp;A membership units as of the grant date. However, as described below, the
	exercise price of these grants was adjusted to $6.00 per unit.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(2)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	In
	December 2014, the board of managers approved an option grant to the chief executive officer when the fair value of our Class&nbsp;A membership units
	was $6.00. The option grant was not issued until December&nbsp;31, 2015, however, management determined that the exercise price should be the fair value of our Class&nbsp;A membership units when
	the grant was approved by the board of managers in December 2014 of $6.00 per unit.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	91
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=97,EFW="2229263",CP="KADMON HOLDINGS, LLC",DN="1",CHK=338384,FOLIO='91',FILE='DISK134:[15ZCV1.15ZCV70901]DM70901A.;77',USER='PJAMES',CD='18-JUL-2016;18:04' -->
<A NAME="A2229263ZS-1A_HTM_PAGE_DM70901_1_92">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2229263ZS-1A_HTM_BG70901A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:15%;">
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(3)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	At
	the time of the option grants on December&nbsp;31, 2015, management determined that the fair value of our Class&nbsp;A membership units of $5.00 per
	unit calculated in the valuation as of September&nbsp;30, 2015 reasonably reflected the per unit fair value of Class&nbsp;A membership units as of the grant date.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	January 2015, the compensation committee of our board of managers approved the amendment of all outstanding option awards under the 2011 Equity Incentive Plan that have an exercise
	price per unit above $6.00 to adjust the exercise price to $6.00 per unit, the estimated fair value of our Class&nbsp;A membership units as of October&nbsp;31, 2014. The amended options have the
	same vesting schedule as the original award. The amendment to the option awards resulted in a modification charge of $1.1&nbsp;million, of which $668,000 was expensed immediately during the first
	quarter of 2015 and the remaining amount is being recognized over the vesting periods of each award. These vesting periods range from one to two years.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A
	total of 9,750, 9,750 and 8,500 units were granted under the LTIP at March&nbsp;31, 2016, December&nbsp;31, 2015 and December&nbsp;31, 2014, respectively. The liability and
	associated compensation expense for this award will not be recognized until an IPO or change of control is consummated. No compensation expense has been recorded under the LTIP through
	March&nbsp;31, 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Intangible assets
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Intangible assets are stated at cost, less accumulated amortization. These assets are tested for impairment at least once annually, if
	determined to have an indefinite life, or whenever events or changes in circumstances indicate that the carrying amount may no longer be recoverable. If any of our intangible or long-lived assets are
	considered to be impaired, the amount of impairment to be recognized is the excess of the carrying amount of the assets over its fair value. Applicable long-lived assets, including intangible assets
	with definitive lives, are amortized or depreciated over the shorter of their estimated useful lives, the estimated period that the assets will generate revenue, or the statutory or contractual term
	in the case of patents. Estimates of useful lives
	and periods of expected revenue generation are reviewed periodically for appropriateness and are based upon management's judgment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Fair value
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We follow the provisions of FASB ASC Topic 820, "Fair Value Measurements and Disclosures" (ASC 820). This pronouncement defines fair
	value, establishes a framework for measuring fair value under GAAP and requires expanded disclosures about fair value measurements. ASC 820 emphasizes that fair value is a market-based measurement,
	not an entity-specific measurement, and defines fair value as the price to sell an asset or transfer a liability in an orderly transaction between market participants at the measurement date. ASC 820
	discusses valuation techniques, such as the market approach (comparable market prices), the income approach (present value of future income or cash flow) and the cost approach (cost to replace the
	service capacity of an asset or replacement cost). These valuation techniques are based upon observable and unobservable inputs. Observable inputs reflect market data obtained from independent
	sources, while unobservable inputs reflect our market assumptions. ASC 820 utilizes a fair value hierarchy that prioritizes inputs to fair value measurement techniques into three broad levels. The
	following is a brief description of those three levels:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Level&nbsp;1:
	Observable inputs such as quoted prices for identical assets or liabilities in active markets.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Level&nbsp;2:
	Observable inputs other than quoted prices that are directly or indirectly observable for the asset or liability, including quoted prices for similar assets or
	liabilities in active markets; quoted prices for similar or identical assets or liabilities in markets that are not active; and model-derived valuations whose inputs are observable or whose
	significant value drivers are observable.
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	92
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=98,EFW="2229263",CP="KADMON HOLDINGS, LLC",DN="1",CHK=304673,FOLIO='92',FILE='DISK134:[15ZCV1.15ZCV70901]DM70901A.;77',USER='PJAMES',CD='18-JUL-2016;18:04' -->
<A NAME="A2229263ZS-1A_HTM_PAGE_DM70901_1_93">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2229263ZS-1A_HTM_BG70901A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Level&nbsp;3:
	Unobservable inputs that reflect the reporting entity's own assumptions.
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	fair value of cash, accounts receivable, accounts payable and other milestone payable approximate their carrying amounts due to their short-term nature.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	JOBS Act
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As an "emerging growth company" (EGC), under the JOBS Act, we can take advantage of an extended transition period for complying with
	new or revised accounting standards. This allows an EGC to delay the adoption of certain accounting standards until those standards would otherwise apply to private companies. We have irrevocably
	elected not to avail ourselves of this extended transition period and, as a result, we will adopt new or revised accounting standards on the relevant dates on which adoption of such standards is
	required for other public companies.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	are in the process of evaluating the benefits of relying on other exemptions and reduced reporting requirements under the JOBS Act. Subject to certain conditions, as an EGC, we intend
	to rely on certain of these exemptions, including without limitation (i)&nbsp;providing an auditor's attestation report on our system of internal controls over financial reporting pursuant to
	Section&nbsp;404(b) of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002 and (ii)&nbsp;complying with any requirement that may be adopted by the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (PCAOB), regarding mandatory
	audit firm rotation or a supplement to the auditor's report providing additional information about the audit and the financial statements, known as the auditor discussion and analysis. We will remain
	an EGC until the earliest of: (i)&nbsp;the last day of the fiscal year in which we have total annual gross revenues of $1&nbsp;billion or more; (ii)&nbsp;the last day of the fiscal year
	following the fifth anniversary of the date of the completion of this offering; (iii)&nbsp;the date on which we have issued more than $1&nbsp;billion in nonconvertible debt during the previous
	three years; and (iv)&nbsp;the date on which we are deemed to be a large accelerated filer under the rules of the SEC.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	93
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>

<!-- END OF USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Revenues
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Total revenue increased by 25%, or approximately $1.9&nbsp;million, to $9.7&nbsp;million for the three months ended
	March&nbsp;31, 2016 from $7.7&nbsp;million for the three months ended March&nbsp;31, 2015. The increase was mostly attributable to the $2.0 million milestone payment earned pursuant to a license
	agreement entered into with Jinghua Pharmaceutical Group&nbsp;Co.,&nbsp;Ltd. to develop products using human monoclonal antibodies. We recognized previously deferred revenue from our license and
	collaboration agreements amounting to $1.1&nbsp;million for each of the three months ended March&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015, and service revenue from our affiliate MeiraGTx Limited (MeiraGTx) of
	$0.3&nbsp;million for the three months ended March&nbsp;31, 2016, while no such service revenue was recognized in the three months ended March&nbsp;31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Sales
	from our ribavirin portfolio have significantly declined, from $63.5&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 to $29.3&nbsp;million for the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2015, as the treatment landscape for chronic HCV infection has rapidly evolved, with multiple ribavirin-free treatment regimens, including novel direct-acting antivirals, having
	entered the market and becoming the new standard of care. As a result, we expect sales of our ribavirin portfolio of products to significantly decline in 2016 and to contribute insignificantly to
	revenue in 2017 and beyond. Sales from our ribavirin portfolio of products are not adequate to fund our operations. As a result, we will need additional capital to fund our operations, which may be
	raised through a combination of equity offerings, debt financings, other third-party funding, marketing and distribution arrangements and other collaborations, strategic alliances, and licensing
	arrangements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	94
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=6,SEQ=100,EFW="2229263",CP="KADMON HOLDINGS, LLC",DN="1",CHK=950319,FOLIO='94',FILE='DISK134:[15ZCV1.15ZCV70901]DM70901A.;77',USER='PJAMES',CD='18-JUL-2016;18:04' -->
<A NAME="A2229263ZS-1A_HTM_PAGE_DM70901_1_95">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2229263ZS-1A_HTM_BG70901A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Cost of sales
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Cost of sales was $1.1&nbsp;million and $1.0&nbsp;million for the three months ended March&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015, respectively,
	which relates primarily to sales of our ribavirin portfolio of products.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Write-down of inventory
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We recognized $0.1&nbsp;million of inventory write-downs during each of the three months ended March&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015 of our
	Ribasphere inventory based on our expectation that such inventory will not be sold prior to reaching its product expiration date.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Research and development expenses
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Research and development expenses increased by 16%, or approximately $1.1&nbsp;million, to $8.0&nbsp;million for the three months
	ended March&nbsp;31, 2016 from $6.9&nbsp;million for the three months ended March&nbsp;31, 2015, primarily related to the advancement of our clinical product candidates.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Selling, general and administrative expenses
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Selling, general and administrative expenses increased by 10%, or approximately $2.3&nbsp;million, to $24.5&nbsp;million for the
	three months ended March&nbsp;31, 2016 from $22.2&nbsp;million for the three months ended March&nbsp;31, 2015. The increase was primarily related to higher employee-related expense of
	$2.1&nbsp;million related to severance agreements and unit-based compensation and an increase of $2.3&nbsp;million in advisory and consulting fees resulting from an advisory agreement entered into
	in April 2015, both of which were non-cash. The increase was partially offset by lower amortization expense related to our Ribasphere intangible asset of $1.8&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Gain on settlement of other milestone payable
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Gain on settlement of other milestone payable consists of a gain of $3.9 million resulting from the mutual termination agreement
	entered into with Valeant.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Other expense
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Other expense consisted primarily of interest expense and other costs related to our debt of $7.9&nbsp;million and
	$6.7&nbsp;million for the three months ended March&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015, respectively. The following table provides components of other expense:
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_16"></A>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Other
	expense consisted primarily of a loss on equity method investment of $4.7&nbsp;million, partially offset by a change in the fair value of financial instruments of
	$0.2&nbsp;million for three months ended March&nbsp;31, 2016. Other income consisted primarily of a change in the fair value of financial instruments of $0.8&nbsp;million and a
	$0.3&nbsp;million foreign exchange gain for three months ended March&nbsp;31, 2015.
</FONT>

<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Revenues
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Total revenue decreased by 62%, or approximately $59.3&nbsp;million, to $35.7&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
	2015 from $95.0&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. The decrease was mostly attributable to the 2014 launches of novel direct-acting antivirals by other pharmaceutical
	companies. As a result of these launches, we expect sales of our ribavirin portfolio of products to continue to decrease.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	recognized milestone revenue from our license agreement with AbbVie amounting to $27.0&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, while no such milestone revenue was
	recognized in 2015. We also recognized previously deferred revenue from our license and collaboration agreements amounting to $5.4&nbsp;million and $4.4&nbsp;million for the years ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, respectively, and service revenue of $1.0&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, while no such service revenue was recognized in 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Cost of sales
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Cost of sales decreased by 39%, or approximately $2.4&nbsp;million, to $3.7&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
	2015 from $6.1&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. The decrease was a direct result of lower sales of our ribavirin portfolio of products.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Write-down of inventory
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We recognized $2.3&nbsp;million and $4.9&nbsp;million of inventory write-downs during the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and
	2014, respectively, of our Ribasphere inventory based on our expectation that such inventory will not be sold prior to reaching its product expiration date.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	96
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=8,SEQ=102,EFW="2229263",CP="KADMON HOLDINGS, LLC",DN="1",CHK=273966,FOLIO='96',FILE='DISK134:[15ZCV1.15ZCV70901]DM70901A.;77',USER='PJAMES',CD='18-JUL-2016;18:04' -->
<A NAME="A2229263ZS-1A_HTM_PAGE_DM70901_1_97">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2229263ZS-1A_HTM_BG70901A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Research and development expenses
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Research and development expenses increased by 2%, or approximately $0.6&nbsp;million, to $29.7&nbsp;million for the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2015 from $29.1&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, primarily related to the advancement of our clinical product candidates.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Selling, general and administrative expenses
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Selling, general and administrative expenses increased by 17%, or approximately $15.4&nbsp;million, to $108.6&nbsp;million for the
	year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 from $93.2&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. The increase was primarily related to higher amortization expense related to our Ribasphere
	intangible asset of $5.6&nbsp;million, additional rent expense of $1.0&nbsp;million and an increase of $24.4&nbsp;million in advisory and consulting fees and legal settlements,
	$24.0&nbsp;million of which were non-cash. The increase was partially offset by lower employee costs of $6.6&nbsp;million as a result of headcount reductions, lower royalty and other sales related
	expenses of $3.8&nbsp;million in connection with revenue declines and lower travel, entertainment and other general and administrative expenses of $2.3&nbsp;million in connection with cost-savings
	initiatives.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Impairment loss on intangible asset
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In September 2015, we reviewed the estimated useful life of the Ribasphere product rights and determined that the actual life of the
	Ribasphere product rights intangible asset was shorter than the estimated useful life used for amortization purposes in our financial statements due to hepatitis C market conditions. As a result,
	effective September&nbsp;30, 2015, we changed the estimate of the useful life of our Ribasphere product rights intangible asset to 1.25&nbsp;years to better reflect the estimated period during
	which the asset will generate cash flows. We also determined that the estimated fair value of the Ribasphere product rights was impaired and recorded an impairment loss of $31.3&nbsp;million in
	September 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Other expense
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Other expense consisted primarily of interest expense and other costs related to our debt of $27.2&nbsp;million and
	$28.9&nbsp;million for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, respectively. The following table provides components of other expense:
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_18"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;WIDTH:70%;MARGIN-LEFT:15%;">

</FONT>
</P>

<FONT>
</FONT>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Other
	income for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 consisted primarily of a $24.0&nbsp;million gain recognized upon the deconsolidation of MeiraGTx and a change in the fair value
	of financial instruments of $1.5&nbsp;million, partially offset by a loss on equity method investment of $2.8&nbsp;million and a $2.9&nbsp;million loss on extinguishment of debt related to the
	repayment of existing debt with the proceeds of the secured term loan in the amount of $35.0&nbsp;million entered into in August 2015 ("2015 Credit Agreement"). Other income for the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2014 consisted primarily of a change in the fair value of financial instruments of $5.0&nbsp;million and a gain on settlement of obligations of $2.3&nbsp;million, partially
	offset by a $4.6&nbsp;million loss on extinguishment of debt.
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT SIZE=2>
	97
</FONT>
</P>

<!-- ZEQ.=9,SEQ=103,EFW="2229263",CP="KADMON HOLDINGS, LLC",DN="1",CHK=968627,FOLIO='97',FILE='DISK134:[15ZCV1.15ZCV70901]DM70901A.;77',USER='PJAMES',CD='18-JUL-2016;18:04' -->
<A NAME="A2229263ZS-1A_HTM_PAGE_DM70901_1_98">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2229263ZS-1A_HTM_BG70901A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_LIQUIDITY>
<A NAME="FIS_LIQUIDITY"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Liquidity and Capital Resources
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Overview
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Since inception, we have incurred operating losses and anticipate that we will continue to incur operating losses for the next several
	years. We expect that our research and development and selling, general and administrative expenses will continue to increase as we develop our product candidates. As a result, we will need additional
	capital to fund our operations, which we may raise through a combination of equity offerings, debt financings, other third-party funding, marketing and distribution arrangements and other
	collaborations, strategic alliances and licensing arrangements. As of March&nbsp;31, 2016, we had $8.6&nbsp;million in cash and cash equivalents and $2.1&nbsp;million in restricted cash pursuant
	to our lease for our headquarters. In June 2016, we raised an additional $5.5&nbsp;million in gross proceeds, with no transaction costs, through the issuance of 478,266 Class&nbsp;E redeemable
	convertible units. To date, we have financed our operations through borrowings under credit facilities and private placements of equity and convertible debt securities, as well as revenue generated
	from the sale of our commercial products.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	report of our independent registered public accounting firm on our financial statements for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014 appearing at the end of this prospectus
	contains an explanatory paragraph stating that our recurring losses from operations, deficiencies in working capital and members' capital raise substantial doubt about our ability to continue as a
	going concern. See "Risk Factors&#151;Our independent registered public accounting firm has expressed doubt about our ability to continue as a going concern."
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Sources of Liquidity
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Since our inception through March&nbsp;31, 2016, we have raised net proceeds from the issuance of Class&nbsp;A membership units of
	approximately $272.9&nbsp;million and proceeds from the issuance of Class&nbsp;E redeemable convertible units of $49.7&nbsp;million. In June 2016, we raised an additional $5.5&nbsp;million in
	gross proceeds, with no transaction costs, through the issuance of 478,266 Class&nbsp;E redeemable convertible units.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
	of March&nbsp;31, 2016, we had $35.0&nbsp;million outstanding under the 2015 Credit Agreement, $74.4&nbsp;million outstanding under the Senior Convertible Term Loan and
	$123.1&nbsp;million of Second-Lien Convert. Lenders in the Senior Convertible Term Loan may elect to convert any portion of principal in increments of $1.0&nbsp;million to Class&nbsp;A
	membership units at any time at a conversion price of $12.00 per Class&nbsp;A membership unit (without giving effect to the reverse split of our membership units to take place as part of our
	Corporate Conversion immediately prior to the completion of this offering), subject to adjustment at the time of an initial public offering. In the event of any qualified underwritten public offering
	of common equity shares, the conversion price of the Senior Convertible Term Loan will be adjusted to the lesser of $12.00 (without giving effect to the reverse split of our membership units to
	take place as part of our Corporate Conversion immediately prior to the completion of this offering) or 84.75% of the per share offering price. Pursuant to an amendment and restatement of the terms of
	our Second-Lien Convert dated as of June&nbsp;8, 2016, concurrently with the closing of this offering 100% of the outstanding balance under our outstanding Second-Lien Convert, which includes the
	amount of the Second-Lien Convert held by the GoldenTree 2015 Convert Lenders, will be mandatorily converted into shares of our common stock at a conversion price equal to 80% of the initial public
	offering price per share in this offering. See "Summary&#151;Retirement of Indebtedness Through Issuance of Convertible Preferred Stock and Common Stock."
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	98
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Operating activities
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The net cash used in operating activities was $12.6&nbsp;million for the three months ended March&nbsp;31, 2016, and consisted
	primarily of a net loss of $32.8&nbsp;million adjusted for non-cash items, including the amortization of intangible assets of $5.6&nbsp;million, depreciation and amortization of fixed assets of
	$0.6&nbsp;million, amortization of deferred financing costs and debt discount of $1.4&nbsp;million, fair value of units issued to third parties to settle obligations of $2.3&nbsp;million, gain
	on settlement of other milestone payable of $3.9&nbsp;million, paid-in-kind interest expense of $5.6&nbsp;million, loss on equity method investment of $4.7&nbsp;million and unit-based
	compensation expense of $3.0&nbsp;million, as well as, a net increase in operating assets and liabilities of $1.2&nbsp;million. The significant items in the change in operating assets and
	liabilities include an increase of $6.7&nbsp;million in accounts payable, accrued expenses, other liabilities and deferred rent primarily resulting from delaying payment of outstanding payables to
	our vendors to preserve liquidity and a $0.5&nbsp;million decrease in inventory related to lower sales of our ribavirin portfolio of products, partially offset by an increase in accounts receivable
	of $2.6&nbsp;million due to timing of collections from our customers and a decrease in deferred revenue of $1.1&nbsp;million related to the recognition of the $44.0&nbsp;million upfront payment
	from the license agreement with AbbVie. The net loss, adjusted for non-cash items, was primarily driven by selling, general and administrative expenses of $24.5&nbsp;million, research and
	development expense related to the advancement of our clinical product candidates of $8.0&nbsp;million and interest paid on our debt of $0.9&nbsp;million partially offset by the net sales (less
	cost of sales) of our ribavirin portfolio of products of $5.1&nbsp;million and milestone revenue from our license agreement with Jinghua Pharmaceutical Group&nbsp;Co.,&nbsp;Ltd amounting to
	$2.0&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	net cash used in operating activities was $12.1&nbsp;million for the three months ended March&nbsp;31, 2015, and consisted primarily of a net loss of $28.0&nbsp;million
	adjusted for non-cash items, including the amortization of intangible assets of $7.4&nbsp;million, depreciation of $0.6&nbsp;million, amortization of deferred financing costs and debt discount of
	$1.2&nbsp;million, paid-in-kind interest expense of $1.6&nbsp;million and unit-based compensation expense of $2.3&nbsp;million, as well as, a net increase in operating assets and liabilities of
	$2.6&nbsp;million. The significant items in the change in operating assets and liabilities include an increase of $9.9&nbsp;million in accounts payable, accrued expenses, other liabilities and
	deferred rent primarily resulting from escrowed subscription agreements for our affiliate MeiraGTx totaling $6.6&nbsp;million and a $0.5&nbsp;million decrease in inventory related to lower sales
	of our ribavirin portfolio of products, partially offset by an increase in restricted cash of $6.6&nbsp;million related to escrowed subscription agreements for our affiliate MeiraGTx, an increase in
	accounts receivable of $0.3&nbsp;million due to due to timing of collections from our customers and a decrease in deferred revenue of $1.2&nbsp;million related to the recognition of the
	$44.0&nbsp;million upfront payment from the license agreement with AbbVie. The net loss, adjusted for non-cash items, was primarily driven by selling, general and administrative expenses of
	$22.2&nbsp;million and research and development expense related to the
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	99
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	advancement
	of our clinical product candidates of $6.9&nbsp;million, partially offset by the net sales (less cost of sales) of our ribavirin portfolio of products of $5.5&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	net cash used in operating activities was $61.4&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, and consisted primarily of a net loss of $147.1&nbsp;million adjusted
	for non-cash items, including the amortization and impairment loss of intangible assets of $58.7&nbsp;million, depreciation of $2.3&nbsp;million, amortization of deferred financing costs and debt
	discount of $5.2&nbsp;million, gain on deconsolidation of subsidiary of $24.0&nbsp;million, fair value of units issued to third parties to settle obligations of $13.6&nbsp;million, accrued legal
	settlement of $10.4&nbsp;million, a loss on extinguishment of debt of $2.9&nbsp;million, paid-in-kind interest expense of $11.4&nbsp;million and unit-based compensation expense of
	$10.3&nbsp;million, as well as a net decrease in operating assets and liabilities of $11.0&nbsp;million. The significant items in the change in operating assets and liabilities include a decrease
	in deferred revenue of $4.4&nbsp;million related to the recognition of the $44.0&nbsp;million upfront payment from the license agreement with AbbVie, a decrease in deferred revenue of
	$5.9&nbsp;million related to the portion of the prepaid royalty from AbbVie that we expect to refund, a decrease of $1.4&nbsp;million in accounts payable, accrued expenses, other liabilities and
	deferred rent primarily resulting from settlement of outstanding payables to our vendors and an increase in accounts receivable of $1.3&nbsp;million due to timing of collections from our customers,
	partially offset by a $1.9&nbsp;million decrease in inventory related to lower sales of our ribavirin portfolio of products. The net loss, adjusted for non-cash items, was primarily driven by
	selling, general and administrative expenses of $42.2&nbsp;million, research and development expense related to the advancement of our clinical product candidates of $29.7&nbsp;million and
	interest paid on our debt of $8.0&nbsp;million partially offset by the net sales (less cost of sales) of our ribavirin portfolio of products of $25.6&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	net cash used in operating activities was $8.5&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, and consisted primarily of a net loss of $64.4&nbsp;million adjusted for
	non-cash items, including the amortization of intangible assets of $21.8&nbsp;million, depreciation of $2.6&nbsp;million, amortization of deferred financing costs and debt discount of
	$3.3&nbsp;million, a loss on extinguishment of debt of $4.6&nbsp;million, paid-in-kind interest expense of $13.4&nbsp;million and unit-based compensation expense of $7.6&nbsp;million, as well
	as a net increase in operating assets and liabilities of $3.5&nbsp;million. The significant items in the change in operating assets and liabilities include an increase in deferred revenue of
	$6.0&nbsp;million related to prepaid royalties received from AbbVie, an increase in restricted cash of $7.5&nbsp;million related to our license agreement with AbbVie and a decrease in accounts
	receivable of $5.8&nbsp;million due to successful collections from our customers, partially offset by a decrease in deferred revenue of $4.4&nbsp;million related to the recognition of the
	$44.0&nbsp;million upfront payment from the license agreement with AbbVie, a decrease of $13.0&nbsp;million in accounts payable, accrued expenses, other liabilities and deferred rent primarily
	resulting from settlement of outstanding payables to our vendors. The net loss, adjusted for non-cash items, was primarily driven by selling, general and administrative expenses of
	$54.8&nbsp;million, research and development expense related to the advancement of our clinical product candidates of $29.1&nbsp;million and interest paid on our debt of $11.5&nbsp;million
	partially offset by the net sales (less cost of sales) of our ribavirin portfolio of products of $57.4&nbsp;million and milestone revenue from our license agreement with AbbVie amounting to
	$27.0&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
</P>

	$10.8&nbsp;million, partially offset by the repayment of senior secured term debt of $107.2&nbsp;million and financing costs of $4.1&nbsp;million.

	$43.6&nbsp;million, partially offset by net proceeds from the issuance of Class&nbsp;E redeemable convertible units of $38.8&nbsp;million and net proceeds from related party loans of
	$3.5&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Future Funding Requirements
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We expect our expenses to increase compared to prior periods in connection with our ongoing activities, particularly as we continue
	research and development, continue and initiate clinical trials and seek regulatory approvals for our product candidates. In anticipation of regulatory approval for any of our product candidates, we
	expect to incur significant pre-commercialization expenses related to product sales, marketing, distribution and manufacturing. Furthermore, upon the closing of this offering, we expect to incur
	additional costs associated with operating as a public company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	expected use of our cash and cash equivalents, including the net proceeds from this offering, represents our intentions based upon our current plans and business conditions, which
	could change in the future as our plans and business conditions evolve. The amounts and timing of our actual expenditures may vary significantly depending on numerous factors, including the progress
	of our development, the status of, and results from, clinical trials, the potential need to conduct additional clinical trials to obtain approval of our product candidates for all intended
	indications, as well as any additional collaborations that we may enter into with third parties for our product candidates and any unforeseen cash needs. As a result, our management will retain broad
	discretion over the allocation of our existing cash and cash equivalents and the net proceeds from this offering.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Based
	on our planned use of the net proceeds from this offering and our existing cash and cash equivalents, we estimate that such funds will be sufficient to enable us to complete our
	planned Phase&nbsp;2 clinical studies for KD025, advance our planned clinical studies for tesevatinib and KD034 and advance certain of our other pipeline product candidates and fund our operating
	expenses and capital expenditure requirements for the next 16&nbsp;months.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Financing Arrangements
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">

</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In August 2015, we entered into the 2015 Credit Agreement in the amount of $35.0&nbsp;million with two lenders. The borrowings were
	partially used to repay our previous senior secured non-convertible

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	term
	loan and to provide additional working capital in support of our growth. The interest rate on the loan is LIBOR plus 9.375% with a 1% floor. If this offering has not been completed before
	June&nbsp;30, 2016, the interest rate on the loan will increase 1.50% per annum. We incurred a $0.8&nbsp;million commitment fee in connection with the loan that will be amortized to interest
	expense over the term of the agreement. Beginning in August 2016, we will be required to make monthly principal payments in the amount of $0.4&nbsp;million. Any outstanding balance of the loan and
	accrued interest is to be repaid on June&nbsp;17, 2018.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	2015 Credit Agreement is unconditionally guaranteed by all of our existing and future domestic subsidiaries, subject to certain exceptions, and is secured, subject to permitted liens
	and other exceptions, by a first-priority lien on substantially all of our present and future assets and those of our subsidiaries. The 2015 Credit Agreement requires us to satisfy certain
	developmental milestones, such as (a)&nbsp;not later than September&nbsp;30, 2016, at least one patient shall have enrolled in a Phase&nbsp;3 clinical trial for tesevatinib for the treatment of
	ADPKD, (b)&nbsp;not later than December&nbsp;31, 2016, at least one patient shall have enrolled in a Phase&nbsp;2b clinical trial for KD025 for the treatment of psoriasis and (c)&nbsp;not
	later than December&nbsp;31, 2016, the FDA shall have accepted an NDA for trientine hydrochloride for the treatment of Wilson's disease. In addition, the 2015 Credit Agreement requires us to satisfy
	certain financial covenants, including maintaining in excess of $5.0&nbsp;million in liquidity at all times and, as of the last day of each calendar month occurring between and including
	June&nbsp;30, 2016 and the first date on which a Qualified IPO (defined as a public offering resulting in gross cash proceeds of at least $50.0&nbsp;million) has occurred, revenue equal to or in
	excess of $20.0&nbsp;million annually. The 2015 Credit Agreement also contains events of default that are usual and customary for comparable facilities, including a change of control. In addition,
	it will be considered an event of default if Dr.&nbsp;Harlan W.
	Waksal ceases to devote substantially all of his time to our business and operations, whether due to death, disability, incapacity or otherwise.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	conjunction with 2015 Credit Agreement, warrants with an aggregate purchase price of $6.3&nbsp;million to acquire Class&nbsp;A membership units were issued to two lenders, of
	which $5.4&nbsp;million was recorded as a debt discount and $0.9&nbsp;million was recorded as loss on extinguishment of debt in our consolidated financial statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Deferred
	financing costs of $1.3&nbsp;million were recognized in recording the 2015 Credit Agreement and will be amortized to interest expense over the three year term of the
	agreement. Additionally, fees paid to one existing lender, inclusive of financial instruments issued of $0.1&nbsp;million, were charged to loss on extinguishment of debt. There was also
	$1.5&nbsp;million of debt discount and $0.4&nbsp;million of deferred financing cost write-offs charged to loss on extinguishment of debt in connection with this transaction.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;At
	March&nbsp;31, 2016, the outstanding balance of the 2015 Credit Agreement was $35.0&nbsp;million and the interest rate was LIBOR plus 9.375% with a 1% floor. We were in compliance
	with all covenants under the 2015 Credit Agreement as of March&nbsp;31, 2016 and December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	August 2015 Third Amended Convertible Debt
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In June 2013, we entered into the Senior Convertible Term Loan. The Senior Convertible Term Loan has a five year term under which the
	total borrowings were $35.0&nbsp;million. Interest is calculated at a rate of 10% and payable-in-kind quarterly as an increase of principal. The Senior Convertible Term Loan is unconditionally
	guaranteed by all of our existing and future domestic subsidiaries, subject to certain exceptions, and is secured, subject to permitted liens and other exceptions, by a first-priority lien on
	substantially all of our present and future assets and those of our subsidiaries.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Lenders
	in the Senior Convertible Term Loan may elect to convert any portion of principal in increments of $1.0&nbsp;million to Class&nbsp;A membership units at any time. The initial
	conversion price was $18.00 per Class&nbsp;A membership unit (without giving effect to the reverse split of our membership units

</P>

	take place as part of our Corporate Conversion immediately prior to the completion of this offering). The lenders may additionally receive a premium on their conversion option should certain events

	agreement. In connection with this transaction, fees paid to existing creditors of $1.7&nbsp;million were charged to loss on extinguishment of debt. We incurred $0.2&nbsp;million in debt issuance
	costs to new creditors, which were recorded as a debt discount being amortized to interest expense over the five year term.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	December 2013, we amended and restated the Senior Convertible Term Loan. The balance related to the Senior Convertible Term Loan was increased by $13.5&nbsp;million with identical
	interest and conversion provisions as the Senior Convertible Term Loan. The amendment adjusted certain required covenant levels to allow for the additional debt.

</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	November 2014, we further amended the Senior Convertible Term Loan and we incurred a $10.0&nbsp;million fee payable to the lenders through an increase to the principal balance by
	the same amount. No changes were made to the interest rate or term of the loan. The conversion price of this loan was amended to be the lesser of $12.00 per unit (without giving effect to the reverse
	split of our membership units to take place as part of our Corporate Conversion immediately prior to the completion of this offering) or discounted at 84.75% of the Class&nbsp;A membership unit
	price (converted into common stock) at the time of an initial public offering (IPO).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
	a result of this amendment, $3.5&nbsp;million was recorded as a debt discount and is being amortized to interest expense over the remaining term of the agreement as the amendment
	was deemed a modification for two creditors. Additionally, fees paid to one other creditor, inclusive of financial instruments issued of $0.2&nbsp;million, were charged to loss on extinguishment of
	debt.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	November 2014, we further amended the Senior Convertible Term Loan permitting us to enter into the 2015 Credit Agreement and Second-Lien Convert.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Senior Convertible Term Loan requires us to satisfy certain developmental milestones, such as (a)&nbsp;not later than September&nbsp;30, 2016, at least one patient shall have
	enrolled in a Phase&nbsp;3 clinical trial for tesevatinib for the treatment of ADPKD, (b)&nbsp;not later than December&nbsp;31, 2016, at least one patient shall have enrolled in a
	Phase&nbsp;2b clinical trial for KD025 for the treatment of psoriasis and (c)&nbsp;not later than December&nbsp;31, 2016, the FDA shall have accepted an NDA for trientine hydrochloride for the
	treatment of Wilson's disease. In addition, the Senior Convertible Term Loan requires us to satisfy
	certain financial covenants, including maintaining in excess of $5.0&nbsp;million in liquidity at all times and, as of the last day of each calendar month occurring between and including
	June&nbsp;30, 2016 and the first date on which a Qualified IPO (defined as a public offering at an implied aggregate equity valuation of at least $1.0&nbsp;billion) has occurred, revenue equal to
	or in excess of $20.0&nbsp;million annually. The Senior Convertible Term Loan also contains events of default that are usual and customary for comparable facilities, including a change of control.
	In addition, it will be considered an event of default if Dr.&nbsp;Harlan W. Waksal ceases to devote substantially all of his time to our business and operations, whether due to death, disability,
	incapacity or otherwise.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
	August&nbsp;28, 2015, we further amended the terms of the Senior Convertible Term Loan to provide for, among other things, the 2015 Credit Agreement. As consideration for the
	amendment, if a qualified IPO has not been completed on or prior to March&nbsp;31, 2016, we agreed to pay an amendment fee equal to $1.3&nbsp;million to be allocated among the lenders. This fee
	was paid in April 2016, as we did not complete a qualified IPO by this date.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Senior Convertible Term Loan provides that if the proceeds from an initial public offering equal or exceed $75&nbsp;million in the aggregate and shares of our common stock are
	listed on the NYSE, we shall take all steps necessary to approve for listing all of the Class&nbsp;A membership units issuable

	under
	the Senior Convertible Term Loan and grant customary piggyback registration rights to the lenders on substantially the same terms as those granted to our members under our Second Amended and
	Restated Limited Liability Company Agreement. See "Shares Eligible for Future Sale&#151;Registration Rights Agreements" for additional information.

<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;At
	March&nbsp;31, 2016, the outstanding balance of the Senior Convertible Term Loan was $74.4&nbsp;million, which included all accrued interest. We were in compliance with all
	covenants under the Senior Convertible Term Loan as of March&nbsp;31, 2016 and December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Pursuant
	to an exchange agreement entered into on June&nbsp;8, 2016 with the holders of our Senior Convertible Term Loan, in consideration of the payment of a make-whole fee,
	(i)&nbsp;$30.0&nbsp;million in aggregate principal amount of the Senior Convertible Term Loan will be exchanged for 30,000 shares of a newly created class of capital stock to be designated as 5%
	Convertible Preferred Stock, which we refer to as the convertible preferred stock; (ii)&nbsp;as to $25.0&nbsp;million in aggregate principal amount of our Senior Convertible Term Loan, we will
	convert 100% of that principal amount into shares of our common stock at a conversion price equal to 80% of the initial public offering price per share in this offering; and (iii)&nbsp;as to
	$20.0&nbsp;million in aggregate principal amount of the Senior Convertible Term Loan, we will convert 125% of that principal amount into shares of our common stock at a conversion price equal to the
	initial public offering price per share in this offering, which shares will be eligible for
	resale by their holders pursuant to the Selling Stockholder Resale Prospectus. The amount of the make-whole fee will be $7,967,614 plus $11,212 for each day after July&nbsp;31, 2016 through and
	including the closing of the exchange agreement (assuming a closing on or before August&nbsp;31, 2016). The make-whole fee will be paid through the issuance of shares of our common stock at an issue
	price equal to 80% of the initial public offering price per share in this offering. We expect to incur a substantial charge as a result of consummating the above transactions since the conversion
	price is equal to a discount to the initial public offering price per share in this offering.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	August 2015 Second-Lien Convertible Debt
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In August&nbsp;2015, we incurred indebtedness in the aggregate principal amount of $92.0&nbsp;million pursuant to our offering of
	Second-Lien Convert. We issued $1.6&nbsp;million and $0.6&nbsp;million in aggregate principal amount of Second-Lien Convert related to the third party fees in September 2015 and November 2015,
	respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	October 2015 and November 2015, we borrowed an additional $5.5&nbsp;million and $15.0&nbsp;million, respectively, and incurred $0.4&nbsp;million in transaction costs under the
	Second-Lien Convert with three additional lenders bringing the total borrowings under the Second-Lien Convert to $114.8&nbsp;million, including $2.3&nbsp;million in third-party fees.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Interest
	on the Second-Lien Convert initially was calculated at a rate of 13.0% and payable semi-annually on October&nbsp;1 and April&nbsp;1 of each year. We may, at our option,
	elect to pay interest due on the Second-Lien Convert: (i)&nbsp;entirely in cash; (ii)&nbsp;entirely as compounded interest, added to the aggregate principal amount of the Second-Lien Convert; or
	(iii)&nbsp;partially in cash and partially as compounded interest, added to the aggregate principal amount of the Second-Lien Convert. Since we have not consummated an initial public offering of not
	less than $50.0&nbsp;million and listed on a national stock exchange (Qualified IPO) on or before March&nbsp;31, 2016, the interest rate automatically increased on April&nbsp;1, 2016 by an
	additional 3.0% and the interest rate will subsequently increase by an additional 3.0% on each October&nbsp;1 and April&nbsp;1 until the interest rate equals 21.0% per annum, which will remain the
	applicable interest rate so long as the Second-Lien Convert remains outstanding. The Second-Lien Convert requires us to satisfy certain developmental milestones and to maintain at all times liquidity
	in excess of $3.0&nbsp;million. The Second-Lien Convert also contains customary events of default.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Second-Lien Convert is unconditionally guaranteed by all of our existing and future domestic subsidiaries, subject to certain exceptions and secured by a second-lien security
	interest in the assets
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	104
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

<A NAME="A2229263ZS-1A_HTM_PAGE_DM70901_1_105">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2229263ZS-1A_HTM_BG70901A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	securing
	the 2015 Credit Agreement and the Senior Convertible Term Loan. We and certain of our subsidiaries entered into an Intercreditor Agreement, dated as of August&nbsp;28, 2015, which sets
	forth the priorities of the security interest in the collateral securing the 2015 Credit Agreement, the Senior Convertible Term Loan and the Second-Lien Convert, the priorities of payment with respect
	to such obligations and certain other matters.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	connection with the issuance of the Second-Lien Convert, we entered into registration rights agreements with the investors thereunder granting them customary piggyback registration
	rights subject to the terms and conditions set forth therein. See "Shares Eligible for Future Sale&#151;Registration Rights Agreements" for additional information.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	incurred $2.3&nbsp;million in third-party fees that were settled through the issuance of additional Second-Lien Convert. Deferred financing costs of $4.2&nbsp;million were
	recognized in recording the Second-Lien Convert and will be amortized to interest expense over the four-year term of the agreement. We incurred $0.1&nbsp;million in debt issuance costs to new
	creditors, which were recorded as a debt discount and is being amortized to interest expense over the four-year term.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
	October&nbsp;27, 2015, we entered into amendments to the 2015 Credit Agreement, the Senior Convertible Term Loan and the Second-Lien Convert permitting us to issue additional
	Second-Lien Convert until December&nbsp;26, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
	of March&nbsp;31, 2016, the $123.1 million balance under the Second-Lien Convert includes principal and all accrued interest through that date. We were in compliance with all
	covenants of the Second-Lien Convert as of March&nbsp;31, 2016 and December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Pursuant
	to an amendment and restatement of the terms of our Second-Lien Convert dated as of June&nbsp;8, 2016, concurrently with the closing of this offering 100% of the outstanding
	balance under our outstanding Second-Lien Convert will be mandatorily converted into shares of our common stock at a conversion price equal to 80% of the initial public offering price per share in
	this offering. We expect to incur a substantial charge as a result of this mandatory conversion since the conversion price is equal to a discount to the initial public offering price per share in this
	offering.
</FONT>
</P>

</FONT>

	We
	also had commitments totaling $2.0&nbsp;million annually until the date of the first sale of the drug PH906, licensed from Yale University, which is
	not included in the table above. This agreement was terminated in April 2016.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>

</FONT>
</DT>

	This

	as the timing and likelihood of such payments are not known with certainty; (b)&nbsp;any royalty payments to third parties as the amounts, timing and likelihood of such payments are not known with
	certainty; (c)&nbsp;contracts that are entered into in the ordinary course of business which are not material in the aggregate in any period presented above, (d)&nbsp;payments totaling
	$2.5&nbsp;million due upon consummation of this offering under settlement agreements, and (e)&nbsp;potential penalties in connection with the timing of our consummation of a qualified IPO.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Off-balance Sheet Arrangements
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During the periods presented we did not have, and we do not currently have, any off-balance sheet arrangements, as defined under the
	SEC rules.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures about Market Risk
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We are exposed to market risk and changes in interest rates. As of March&nbsp;31, 2016, we had cash and cash equivalents of
	$8.6&nbsp;million, consisting of cash and money market accounts. Due to the short-term duration of our investment portfolio, an immediate 100 basis point change in interest rates would not have a
	material effect on the fair market value of our portfolio.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Based
	on our variable-rate debt outstanding as of March&nbsp;31, 2016, a 100 basis point change versus the market interest rates available on March&nbsp;31, 2016 would result in an
	additional $0.4&nbsp;million of interest expense annually.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Concentrations
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Major Customers
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Sales to AbbVie accounted for approximately 35% and 19% of our aggregate net sales for the three months ended March&nbsp;31, 2016 and
	2015, respectively. Sales to Richmond Pharmaceuticals,&nbsp;Inc. accounted for approximately 12% and 19% of our aggregate net sales for the three months ended March&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015,
	respectively. Net accounts receivable from these customers totaled $1.9&nbsp;million and $0.6&nbsp;million at March&nbsp;31, 2016 and December&nbsp;31, 2015, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Sales
	to AbbVie and Richmond Pharmaceuticals,&nbsp;Inc., accounted for approximately 11% and 20%, respectively, of our aggregate net sales for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015.
	Net accounts receivable from AbbVie and Richmond Pharmaceuticals, Inc. totaled $0.5&nbsp;million and $42,000, respectively, at December&nbsp;31, 2015. Sales to AbbVie accounted for approximately
	20% of our aggregate net sales for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. Net accounts receivable from AbbVie totaled $0.4 million at December&nbsp;31, 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Major Suppliers
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Due to requirements of the U.S. Food and Drug Administration and other factors, we are generally unable to make immediate changes to
	our supplier arrangements. Manufacturing services related to each of our pharmaceutical products are primarily provided by a single source. Our raw materials are also provided by a single source for
	each product. Management attempts to mitigate this risk through long-term contracts and inventory safety stock.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	106
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=18,SEQ=112,EFW="2229263",CP="KADMON HOLDINGS, LLC",DN="1",CHK=443957,FOLIO='106',FILE='DISK134:[15ZCV1.15ZCV70901]DM70901A.;77',USER='PJAMES',CD='18-JUL-2016;18:04' -->
<!-- THIS IS THE END OF A COMPOSITION COMPONENT -->
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2229263ZS-1A_HTM_PAGE_DO70901_1_107">
</A>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_BASECOLOR,"BLACK" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DEFAULTFONT,"FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TABLESHADECOLOR,"#CCEEFF" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_STABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DTABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:DOUBLE #000000 2.25PT;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_SCRTABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;" -->
