<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	Kadmon Holdings,&nbsp;LLC and Subsidiaries
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Notes to consolidated financial statements (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	(unaudited as of March&nbsp;31, 2016 and for the three months ended March&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	3. Summary of Significant Accounting Policies (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Allowance for Doubtful Accounts
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company reviews the collectability of accounts receivable based on an assessment of historic experience, current economic
	conditions, and other collection indicators. The Company has recorded an allowance for doubtful accounts of $0.7&nbsp;million, $0.7&nbsp;million and $1.5&nbsp;million at March&nbsp;31, 2016,
	December&nbsp;31, 2015 and December&nbsp;31, 2014, respectively. Adjustments to the
	allowance for doubtful accounts are recorded to selling, general and administrative expenses, and amounted to $5,000 and $66,000 for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, respectively,
	and $2,000 for the three months ended March&nbsp;31, 2015. No adjustments to the allowance for doubtful accounts were recorded for the three months ended March&nbsp;31, 2016. When accounts are
	determined to be uncollectible they are written off against the reserve balance and the reserve is reassessed. When payments are received on reserved accounts they are applied to the customer's
	account and the reserve is reassessed.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Inventories
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Inventories are stated at the lower of cost or market (on a first-in, first-out basis) using standard costs. Standard costs include an
	allocation of overhead rates, which include those costs attributable to managing the supply chain and are evaluated regularly. Variances are expensed as incurred.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Company regularly reviews the expiration date of its inventories and maintains a reserve for inventories that are probable to expire before shipment. Inventories recorded on the
	Company's consolidated balance sheets are net of a reserve for expirable inventory of $5.8&nbsp;million, $5.4&nbsp;million and $7.1&nbsp;million at March&nbsp;31, 2016, December&nbsp;31,
	2015 and December&nbsp;31, 2014, respectively. The Company expensed Ribasphere&reg; and Infergen inventory that it believes will not be sold prior to reaching its product expiration date
	totaling $2.3&nbsp;million and $4.9&nbsp;million during the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, respectively, and $0.1&nbsp;million during each of the three months ended
	March&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015. If the amount and timing of future sales differ from management's assumptions, adjustments to estimated inventory reserves may be required.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Inventories
	are comprised of the following (in thousands):
</FONT>
</P>

<TR BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF" VALIGN="TOP">

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Deferred Offering Costs
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Deferred offering costs, which consisted primarily of direct costs related to the Company's initial public offering of its common
	stock, are being capitalized in other current assets until the consummation of the initial public offering. These offering costs will be reclassified to additional paid-in capital upon the closing of
	the Company's initial public offering. There was $1.8&nbsp;million and $0.9&nbsp;million in deferred offering costs capitalized as of March&nbsp;31, 2016 and December&nbsp;31, 2015,
	respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	F-19
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=12,SEQ=253,EFW="2229263",CP="KADMON HOLDINGS, LLC",DN="1",CHK=330969,FOLIO='F-19',FILE='DISK134:[15ZCV1.15ZCV70901]FM70901A.;32',USER='OALBERT',CD='26-JUL-2016;07:55' -->
<A NAME="A2229263ZS-1A_HTM_PAGE_FM70901_1_20">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2229263ZS-1A_HTM_BG70901A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	Kadmon Holdings,&nbsp;LLC and Subsidiaries
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Notes to consolidated financial statements (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	(unaudited as of March&nbsp;31, 2016 and for the three months ended March&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	3. Summary of Significant Accounting Policies (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Investments
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company follows FASB ASC Topic 323, "Investments&#151;Equity Method and Joint Ventures" ("ASC 323"), in accounting for its
	investment in a joint venture. In the event the Company's share of the joint venture's net losses reduces the Company's investment to zero, the Company will discontinue applying the equity method and
	will not provide for additional losses unless the Company has guaranteed obligations of the joint venture or is otherwise committed to provide further financial support for the joint venture. If the
	joint venture subsequently reports net income, the Company will resume applying the equity method only after its share of that net income equals the share of net losses not recognized during the
	period the equity method was suspended.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Company follows FASB ASC Topic 325, "Investments&#151;Other" ("ASC 325"), in accounting for its investment in the stock of another company. In the event further contributions
	or additional shares are purchased, the Company will increase the basis in the investment. In the event distributions are made or indications exist that the fair value of the investment has decreased
	below the carrying amount, the Company will decrease the value of the investment as considered appropriate.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Company's total investment balance totaled $18.8&nbsp;million, $23.5&nbsp;million and $2.3&nbsp;million as of March&nbsp;31, 2016, December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014,
	respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For
	all non-consolidated investments, the Company will continually assess the applicability of FASB ASC Topic 810, "Consolidation" ("ASC 810"), to determine if the investments qualify
	for consolidation. At March&nbsp;31, 2016, December&nbsp;31, 2015 and December&nbsp;31, 2014, no such investments qualified for consolidation (Note&nbsp;10).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Fixed Assets
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Fixed assets are recorded at cost and depreciated over their estimated useful lives. Leasehold improvements are amortized over the
	shorter of their estimated useful lives or the lease term, using the straight-line method. Construction-in-progress and software under development are stated at cost and not depreciated. These items
	are transferred to fixed assets when the assets are placed into service.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Intangible Assets
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Intangible assets are stated at cost, less accumulated amortization. The Company accounts for the purchases of intangible assets in
	accordance with FASB ASC Topic 350 "Intangibles&#151;Goodwill and Other". Intangible assets are recognized based on their acquisition cost. The assets will be tested for impairment at least
	once annually, if determined to have an indefinite life, or whenever events or changes in circumstances indicate that the carrying amount may no longer be recoverable. If any of the Company's
	intangible or long-lived assets are considered to be impaired, the amount of impairment to be recognized is the excess of the carrying amount of the assets over its fair value. Applicable long-lived
	assets, including intangible assets with definitive lives, are amortized or depreciated over the shorter of their estimated useful lives, the estimated period that the assets will generate revenue, or
	the statutory or contractual term in the case of patents. Estimates of useful lives and periods of expected revenue generation are reviewed periodically for appropriateness and are based upon
	management's judgment. An impairment of $31.3&nbsp;million was recognized during the
	year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, while no such impairment was recognized during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 or during the three months ended March&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015
	(Note&nbsp;9).
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	F-20
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=13,SEQ=254,EFW="2229263",CP="KADMON HOLDINGS, LLC",DN="1",CHK=583794,FOLIO='F-20',FILE='DISK134:[15ZCV1.15ZCV70901]FM70901A.;32',USER='OALBERT',CD='26-JUL-2016;07:55' -->
<A NAME="A2229263ZS-1A_HTM_PAGE_FM70901_1_21">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2229263ZS-1A_HTM_BG70901A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	Kadmon Holdings,&nbsp;LLC and Subsidiaries
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Notes to consolidated financial statements (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	(unaudited as of March&nbsp;31, 2016 and for the three months ended March&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	3. Summary of Significant Accounting Policies (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Goodwill
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company's goodwill relates to the 2010 acquisition of Kadmon Pharmaceuticals, a Pennsylvania limited liability company that was
	formed in April 2000. Goodwill is not amortized, but rather is assessed for impairment annually or upon the occurrence of an event that indicates impairment may have occurred, in accordance with FASB
	ASC Topic 350 "Intangibles&#151;Goodwill and Other". No impairment to goodwill was recorded during the three months ended March&nbsp;31, 2016 and March&nbsp;31, 2015 or the years ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2015 and December&nbsp;31, 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Impairment of Long-Lived Assets
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Long-lived assets, such as intangible assets (other than goodwill) and fixed assets, are evaluated for impairment periodically, or when
	events or changes in circumstances indicate that the carrying amount of the assets may not be recoverable. When any such impairment exists, a charge is recorded in the statement of operations to
	adjust the carrying value of the related assets.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Company performed a trigger analysis over all other long-lived assets at the lowest identifiable level of cash flows and determined that an impairment existed as of
	December&nbsp;31, 2015 (Note&nbsp;9) and no impairment triggers existed as of March&nbsp;31, 2016 and December&nbsp;31, 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Accounting for Leases
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company recognizes rent expense for operating leases as of the earlier of the possession date or the lease commencement date.
	Rental expense, inclusive of rent escalations, rent holidays, concessions and tenant allowances are recognized over the lease term on a straight-line basis. See Note&nbsp;14 for a further discussion
	of operating leases.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Company has entered into capital lease agreements for information technology and laboratory equipment. As a result of these leases, the Company capitalized $20,000 and $72,000 as
	office equipment and furniture during the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, respectively, and $229,000 as office equipment and furniture during the three months ended March&nbsp;31,
	2016. The Company did not enter into any capital leases during the three months ended March&nbsp;31, 2015. The unamortized portion of capital leases totaled $272,000, $52,000 and $108,000 at
	March&nbsp;31, 2016, December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Accounting for Contingencies
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company follows the guidance of FASB ASC Topic 450, "Contingencies" ("ASC 450"), in accounting for contingencies. If some amount
	within a range of loss is probable and appears at the time to be a better estimate than any other amount within the range, that amount shall be expensed. If a loss is probable, and no amount within
	the range is a better estimate than any other amount, the estimated minimum amount in the range shall be expensed.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	F-21
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

<A NAME="A2229263ZS-1A_HTM_PAGE_FO70901_1_22">
</A>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_BASECOLOR,"BLACK" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DEFAULTFONT,"FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TABLESHADECOLOR,"#CCEEFF" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_STABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DTABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:DOUBLE #000000 2.25PT;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_SCRTABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DCRTABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:DOUBLE #000000 2.25PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;" -->
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2229263ZS-1A_HTM_BG70901A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	Kadmon Holdings,&nbsp;LLC and Subsidiaries
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Notes to consolidated financial statements (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	(unaudited as of March&nbsp;31, 2016 and for the three months ended March&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	3. Summary of Significant Accounting Policies (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Fair Value of Financial Instruments
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company follows the provisions of FASB ASC Topic 820, "Fair Value Measurements and Disclosures" ("ASC 820"). This pronouncement
	defines fair value, establishes a framework for measuring fair value under GAAP and requires expanded disclosures about fair value measurements. ASC 820 emphasizes that fair value is a market-based
	measurement, not an entity-specific measurement, and defines fair value as the price to sell an asset or transfer a liability in an orderly transaction between market participants at the measurement
	date. ASC 820 discusses valuation techniques, such as the market approach (comparable market prices), the income approach (present value of future income or cash flow) and the cost approach (cost to
	replace the service capacity of an asset or replacement cost). These valuation techniques are based upon observable and unobservable inputs. Observable inputs reflect market data obtained from
	independent sources, while unobservable inputs reflect the Company's market assumptions. ASC 820 utilizes a fair value hierarchy that prioritizes inputs to fair value measurement techniques into three
	broad levels. The following is a brief description of those three levels:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Level&nbsp;1: Observable inputs such as quoted prices for identical assets or liabilities in active markets.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Level&nbsp;2: Observable inputs other than quoted prices that are directly or indirectly observable for the asset or liability,
	including quoted prices for similar assets or liabilities in active markets; quoted prices for similar or identical assets or liabilities in markets that are not active; and model-derived valuations
	whose inputs are observable or whose significant value drivers are observable.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Level&nbsp;3: Unobservable inputs that reflect the reporting entity's own assumptions.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	fair value of cash, accounts receivable, accounts payable and other milestone payable approximate their carrying amounts due to their short term nature (Note&nbsp;7).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Loan Modifications and Extinguishments
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company follows the provisions of FASB ASC Subtopic 470-50 "Debt Modifications and Extinguishments" ("ASC 470-60") and ASC Subtopic
	470-60, "Troubled Debt Restructurings by Debtors" ("ASC 470-60"). Under ASC 470-50, an exchange of debt instruments between or a modification of a debt instrument by a debtor and a creditor in a
	nontroubled debt situation is deemed to have been accomplished with debt instruments that are substantially different if the present value of the cash flows under the terms of the new debt instrument
	is at least 10&nbsp;percent different from the present value of the remaining cash flows under the terms of the original instrument. If the terms of a debt instrument are changed or modified and the
	cash flow effect on a present value basis is less than 10&nbsp;percent, the debt instruments are not considered to be substantially different, except in the following two
	circumstances:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	A modification or an exchange affects the terms of an embedded conversion option, from which the change in the fair value of the
	embedded conversion option (calculated as the difference between the fair value of the embedded conversion option immediately before and after the
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	F-22
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=256,EFW="2229263",CP="KADMON HOLDINGS, LLC",DN="1",CHK=738911,FOLIO='F-22',FILE='DISK134:[15ZCV1.15ZCV70901]FO70901A.;22',USER='PJAMES',CD='18-JUL-2016;18:05' -->
<A NAME="A2229263ZS-1A_HTM_PAGE_FO70901_1_23">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2229263ZS-1A_HTM_BG70901A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	Kadmon Holdings,&nbsp;LLC and Subsidiaries
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Notes to consolidated financial statements (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	(unaudited as of March&nbsp;31, 2016 and for the three months ended March&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	3. Summary of Significant Accounting Policies (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	modification
	or exchange) is at least 10&nbsp;percent of the carrying amount of the original debt instrument immediately before the modification or exchange.
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	A modification or an exchange of debt instruments adds a substantive conversion option or eliminates a conversion option that was
	substantive at the date of the modification or exchange.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Under
	ASC 470-60, a restructuring of a debt constitutes a troubled debt restructuring for purposes of this Subtopic if the creditor for economic or legal reasons related to the debtor's
	financial difficulties grants a concession to the debtor that it would not otherwise consider.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Warrants and Derivative Liabilities
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company accounts for its derivative financial instruments in accordance with FASB ASC Topic&nbsp;815, "Derivatives and Hedging"
	("ASC 815"). The Company does not have derivative financial instruments that are hedges. ASC 815 establishes accounting and reporting standards requiring that derivative instruments, both freestanding
	and embedded in other contracts, be recorded on the balance sheet as either an asset or liability measured at its fair value each reporting period. ASC 815 also requires that changes in the fair value
	of derivative instruments be recognized currently in the results of operations unless specific criteria are met. For embedded features that are not clearly and closely related to the host instrument,
	are not carried at fair value, and are derivatives, the feature will be bifurcated and recorded as an asset or liability as noted above, unless the exceptions below are not met. Freestanding
	instruments that do not meet these exceptions will be accounted for in the same manner.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;ASC
	815 provides an exception&#151;if an embedded derivative or freestanding instrument is both indexed to the company's own units and classified in members' units, it can be
	accounted for in members' unit. If at least one of the criteria is not met, the embedded derivative or warrant is classified as an asset or liability and recorded to fair value each reporting period
	through the income statement.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Company assesses classification of our unit purchase warrants, other freestanding derivatives, and embedded features at each reporting date to determine whether a change in
	classification is required. The Company's accounting for its embedded features, the warrants and the success fee, are explained further in Note&nbsp;7.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Recent Accounting Pronouncements
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In March 2016, the FASB issued Accounting Standards Update ("ASU") No.&nbsp;2016-09,
	"
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Compensation&#151;Stock Compensation
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	" ("ASU 2016-09"). This ASU simplifies several aspects of the accounting for share-based payment
	transactions, including the income tax consequences, classification of awards as either equity or liabilities, and classification on the statement of cash flows. This guidance is effective for annual
	and interim reporting periods of public entities beginning after December&nbsp;15, 2016, with early adoption permitted. The Company is currently evaluating the impact of adopting the standard on its
	consolidated financial statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	March 2016, the FASB issued Accounting Standards Update ("ASU") No.&nbsp;2016-08, "
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Revenue from Contracts with Customers
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	" ("ASU
	2016-08"). This ASU amends the existing accounting guidance for principal versus agent considerations when recognizing revenue from contracts with customers. This
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	F-23
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">

</FONT>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	Kadmon Holdings,&nbsp;LLC and Subsidiaries
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Notes to consolidated financial statements (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	(unaudited as of March&nbsp;31, 2016 and for the three months ended March&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	3. Summary of Significant Accounting Policies (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	guidance
	is effective for annual and interim reporting periods of public entities beginning after December&nbsp;15, 2017, with early adoption permitted. In May 2014, the FASB issued ASU
	No.&nbsp;2014-09,
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	"Revenue from Contracts with Customers."
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Under this guidance, an entity is required to recognize revenue upon transfer of promised
	goods or services to customers, in an amount that reflects the expected consideration received in exchange for those goods or services. As such, an entity will need to use more judgment and make more
	estimates than under the current guidance. The Company is currently evaluating the appropriate transition method and any impact of this guidance on its consolidated financial statements and related
	disclosures.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	March 2016, the FASB issued Accounting Standards Update ("ASU") No.&nbsp;2016-06, "
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Derivatives and Hedging
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	" ("ASU 2016-06"). This ASU
	clarifies the requirements for assessing whether contingent call (put) options that can accelerate the payment of principal on debt instruments are clearly and closely related to their debt hosts.
	This guidance is effective for annual and interim reporting periods of public entities beginning after December&nbsp;15, 2016, with early adoption permitted. An entity should apply the
	amendments in this ASU on a modified retrospective basis to existing debt instruments as of the beginning of the fiscal year for which the amendments are effective. The Company is currently evaluating
	the impact of adopting the standard on its consolidated financial statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	February 2016, the FASB issued Accounting Standards Update ("ASU") No.&nbsp;2016-02, "
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Leases
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	" ("ASU 2016-02"). This ASU amends the
	existing accounting standards for lease accounting, including requiring lessees to recognize most leases on their balance sheets. This guidance is effective for annual and interim reporting periods of
	public entities beginning after December&nbsp;15, 2018, with early adoption permitted. The Company is currently evaluating the impact of adopting the standard on its consolidated financial
	statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	November 2015, the FASB issued ASU No.&nbsp;2015-17, "
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Income Taxes (Topic 740)
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	" which simplifies the presentation of deferred income
	taxes. It requires that deferred tax liabilities and assets be classified as noncurrent in a classified statement of financial position. This standard is effective for annual reporting periods
	beginning after December&nbsp;15, 2016 with early adoption permitted as of the beginning of an interim or annual reporting period. The new guidance may be applied either prospectively to all
	deferred tax liabilities and assets or retrospectively to all periods presented. The Company adopted ASU 2015-17 in fiscal year 2015 and applied the guidance retrospectively to all periods presented.
	The adoption of ASU 2015-17 did not have a significant impact on the Company's consolidated financial statements or related disclosures.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	August 2015, the FASB issued ASU No.&nbsp;2015-15, "
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Interest&#151;imputation of interest (Subtopic&nbsp;835-30)" which
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	updated the accounting guidance related to the balance sheet presentation of debt issuance costs specific to line of credit arrangements. The updated accounting guidance allows the option of
	presenting deferred debt issuance costs related to line-of-credit arrangements as an asset, and subsequently amortizing over the term of the line-of-credit arrangement, regardless of whether there are
	any outstanding borrowings. The Company adopted ASU No.&nbsp;2015-15 in fiscal year 2015, which had no impact on its consolidated financial statements or related disclosures.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	July 2015, the FASB issued ASU No.&nbsp;2015-11, "
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Inventory (Topic 330)
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	" which simplifies the subsequent measurement of inventory. It
	replaces the current lower of cost or market test with a lower of cost or net realizable value test. The standard is effective for public entities for annual reporting
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	F-24
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2229263ZS-1A_HTM_BG70901A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	Kadmon Holdings,&nbsp;LLC and Subsidiaries
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Notes to consolidated financial statements (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	(unaudited as of March&nbsp;31, 2016 and for the three months ended March&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	3. Summary of Significant Accounting Policies (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	periods
	beginning after December&nbsp;15, 2016, and interim periods therein. Early adoption is permitted. The new guidance must be applied prospectively. The Company is currently evaluating the
	impact of adopting the standard on its consolidated financial statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	April 2015, the FASB issued ASU No.&nbsp;2015-03
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	, "Interest&#151;Imputation of Interest (Subtopic&nbsp;835-30)".
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	This
	standard amends existing guidance to require the presentation of debt issuance costs in the balance sheet as a deduction from the carrying amount of the related debt liability instead of a deferred
	charge. It is effective for annual reporting periods beginning after December&nbsp;15, 2015, but early adoption is permitted. The Company adopted this standard on its consolidated financial
	statements during 2015 and retroactively adjusted the prior year's presentations to conform to the current presentation. These reclassifications had no effect on previously reported net income.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	August 2014, the FASB issued ASU No.&nbsp;2014-15,
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	"Disclosure of Uncertainties about an Entity's Ability to Continue as a Going
	Concern,"
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	to provide guidance on management's responsibility in evaluating whether there is substantial doubt about a company's ability to continue as a going concern and to
	provide related footnote disclosures. The Company adopted ASU 2014-15 in fiscal year 2016 which did not have a significant impact on its consolidated financial statements or related disclosures.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	4. Members' Capital
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Class&nbsp;A Units
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Class&nbsp;A units represent the Company's common stock equivalents. Kadmon I,&nbsp;LLC ("Kadmon I"), holds 35,426,769
	Class&nbsp;A units, or approximately 66% of the outstanding Kadmon Holdings,&nbsp;LLC Class&nbsp;A units at March&nbsp;31, 2016. Kadmon I is a Delaware limited liability company that was
	formed in August 2009 and is an affiliate of the Company (Note&nbsp;17). The funds were raised through a private offering of 80% of Kadmon I's total membership interests, the other 20% being owned
	by certain other members, including executive officers.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Once
	each Kadmon I investor has received aggregate distributions equal to four times the amount of their initial investment, their collective ownership percentage in additional
	distributions will decrease from 80% to 50%, and the collective ownership percentage for the executive officers and members in Kadmon I, and those certain other members who received units will
	increase from 20% to 50%. The change in ownership percentages will require the Company to evaluate whether such changes will result in additional compensation expense. As of March&nbsp;31, 2016 and
	December&nbsp;31, 2015, the Kadmon I investors had not received any distributions. Accordingly, no additional compensation expense was recognized.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During
	2014, the Company issued 47,081 Class&nbsp;A units as partial settlement of an obligation with respect to commission payable (Note&nbsp;12), 200,000 Class&nbsp;A units as
	full settlement of compensation owed to a third party for fund raising efforts in 2013 (Note&nbsp;12) and 220,000 Class&nbsp;A units with a fair value of $1.3&nbsp;million pursuant to a license
	agreement entered into in September 2013 (Note&nbsp;10). The Company also issued 8,000 Class&nbsp;A units to an employee, resulting in unit-based compensation expense of $56,000 and issued 8,505
	Class&nbsp;A units as the result of stock option exercises. In November 2014, a key employee transferred a portion of Kadmon I ownership interest to another executive officer, resulting in
	unit-based compensation expense of $3.0&nbsp;million during the fourth quarter of 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	F-25
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>

<FONT SIZE=2>

	Kadmon Holdings,&nbsp;LLC and Subsidiaries
</B>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Notes to consolidated financial statements (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	(unaudited as of March&nbsp;31, 2016 and for the three months ended March&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	4. Members' Capital (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During
	2015, the Company raised $15.0&nbsp;million in net proceeds through the issuance of 1,250,000 Class&nbsp;A units. The Company also issued 1,500,000 Class&nbsp;A units
	pursuant to an advisory agreement entered into in April 2015. The Company recorded a deferred charge of $9.0&nbsp;million related to the issuance of these units which was classified as a prepaid
	expense on the Company's balance sheet and is being expensed over the one year term in the advisory agreement. The Company expensed $6.0&nbsp;million related to the advisory agreement during the
	year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015. The Company issued 5,011 Class&nbsp;A units as the result of stock option exercises during 2015. The Company also issued 308,334 Class&nbsp;A Units to settle
	third party obligations, for which the Company expensed $1.5&nbsp;million related to these settlements during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During
	the first three months of 2016, the Company issued 25,000 Class&nbsp;A units to settle third party obligations, for which the Company expensed $0.1&nbsp;million related to
	these settlements during the three months ended March&nbsp;31, 2016 and issued 6,700 Class&nbsp;A units as the result of stock option exercises. The Company also recorded expense of
	$2.3&nbsp;million related to the advisory agreement entered into in April 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Class&nbsp;B Unit
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Class&nbsp;B unit does not participate in distributions from the Company, does not have any preferences in relation to the
	Class&nbsp;A membership units, is non-voting, and is non-redeemable. The only right afforded to the Class&nbsp;B unit is the right to convert into Class&nbsp;A units pursuant to the Company's
	Second Amended and Restated Limited Liability Company Operating Agreement, as amended (the "Operating Agreement") (See "Conversion Event" below). One Class&nbsp;B unit is issued and outstanding as
	of March&nbsp;31, 2016, December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Class&nbsp;C Unit
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Class&nbsp;C unit does not participate in distributions from the Company, does not have any preferences in relation to the
	Class&nbsp;A membership units, is non-voting, and is non-redeemable. The only right afforded to the Class&nbsp;C unit is the right to convert into Class&nbsp;A units pursuant to the Company's
	Operating Agreement (See "Conversion Event" below). One Class&nbsp;C unit is issued and outstanding as of March&nbsp;31, 2016, December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Class&nbsp;D Units
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Class&nbsp;D units do not participate in distributions from the Company, do not have any preferences in relation to the
	Class&nbsp;A membership units, are non-voting, and are non-redeemable. The only right afforded to the Class&nbsp;D unit is the right to convert into Class&nbsp;A units pursuant to the Company's
	Operating Agreement (See "Conversion Event" below). There are 4,373,674 Class&nbsp;D units issued and outstanding as of March&nbsp;31, 2016, December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Class&nbsp;E Units
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During 2014, the Operating Agreement was amended to create a new class of membership units known as Class&nbsp;E units, of which
	there can be multiple series. Only one series, the Class&nbsp;E Series&nbsp;E-1 units (the "Class&nbsp;E units"), has been authorized thus far. The Company may issue up to an aggregate
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	F-26
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>

<A NAME="A2229263ZS-1A_HTM_PAGE_FO70901_1_27">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2229263ZS-1A_HTM_BG70901A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	Kadmon Holdings,&nbsp;LLC and Subsidiaries
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Notes to consolidated financial statements (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	(unaudited as of March&nbsp;31, 2016 and for the three months ended March&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	4. Members' Capital (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	of
	$75&nbsp;million of Class&nbsp;E original issue price, calculated in accordance with the terms of the Operating Agreement, of any series without being subject to preemptive rights. The
	Class&nbsp;E units have voting rights and powers equal to the Class&nbsp;A units on an as-if converted basis, have a liquidation preference for liquidating distributions and participate in
	distributions from the Company on an as-converted basis on non-liquidating distributions. In the case of a qualified initial public offering, the Class&nbsp;E units automatically convert into
	Class&nbsp;A units at a conversion price of the lower of 85% of the value of Class&nbsp;A units (or the price per share of common stock of the corporate successor to the Company) or $11.50 per
	unit. Prior to a qualified initial public offering, the Class&nbsp;E units may be converted at $11.50 per unit. A qualified initial public offering is defined as an offering of the Company's equity
	interests with gross proceeds to the Company of at least $75&nbsp;million. At any time after December&nbsp;31, 2017, Class&nbsp;E units will be redeemable for cash at the option of the holders
	of at least 80% of all Class&nbsp;E Units at a redemption price equal to 125% of the liquidation preference. After January&nbsp;1, 2016 all Class&nbsp;E units began to accrue a liquidation
	preference (payable in connection with such liquidating distribution from the Company) at a rate of 5% per annum, compounding annually, with such liquidation preference rate increasing by 100 basis
	points every six months to a maximum of 10%. Redemption is subject to the Company's ability to make such payment under then-existing debt obligations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Based
	on the terms of the Class&nbsp;E units, the fair value of the Class&nbsp;E units issued will be classified as mezzanine capital on the Company's consolidated balance sheet. The
	Company will accrete changes in the redemption value of the Class&nbsp;E units to paid-in capital using the interest method, as the Company does not have available retained earnings, from the date
	of issuance to the earliest redemption date.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During
	2014, the Company raised $39.5&nbsp;million in gross proceeds, $36.4&nbsp;million net of $3.1&nbsp;million in transaction costs, through the issuance of 3,438,984
	Class&nbsp;E units. Of the $3.1&nbsp;million in transactions costs, $2.4&nbsp;million remains in accrued liabilities as of December&nbsp;31, 2015, relating to commissions to third parties for
	Class&nbsp;E raises. The Company also issued 10,435 Class&nbsp;E units to settle fees payable to certain board members, resulting in unit-based compensation expense of $63,000 during the fourth
	quarter of 2014. These units were issued in January 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During
	2015, the Company raised $10.9&nbsp;million in gross proceeds, $10.8&nbsp;million net of $40,000 in transaction costs, through the issuance of 945,441 Class&nbsp;E units.
	The Company raised $10.0&nbsp;million through the issuance of Class&nbsp;E units in October 2015 pursuant to a license agreement entered into with Jinghua Pharmaceutical
	Group&nbsp;Co.,&nbsp;Ltd to develop products using human monoclonal antibodies (Note&nbsp;10) and $0.9&nbsp;million through the issuance of Class&nbsp;E units to other third party investors.
	The Company also issued 574,392 Class&nbsp;E units to settle certain obligations totaling $6.6&nbsp;million, of which $6.1&nbsp;million was expensed in 2015 and $500,000 relates to the
	settlement of a related party loan entered into in 2014 (Note&nbsp;17). No Class&nbsp;E units were issued during the first three months of 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Conversion Event
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The holders of Class&nbsp;B, C and D units only participate in distributions if and when those units are converted into
	Class&nbsp;A units pursuant to the Company's Operating Agreement. The Class&nbsp;B, C and D units automatically convert into Class&nbsp;A units upon certain defined conversion events including,
	but not limited to, dissolution of the Company or an underwritten initial public offering of the Company's
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	F-27
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=6,SEQ=261,EFW="2229263",CP="KADMON HOLDINGS, LLC",DN="1",CHK=344702,FOLIO='F-27',FILE='DISK134:[15ZCV1.15ZCV70901]FO70901A.;22',USER='PJAMES',CD='18-JUL-2016;18:05' -->
<A NAME="A2229263ZS-1A_HTM_PAGE_FO70901_1_28">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2229263ZS-1A_HTM_BG70901A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	Kadmon Holdings,&nbsp;LLC and Subsidiaries
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Notes to consolidated financial statements (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	(unaudited as of March&nbsp;31, 2016 and for the three months ended March&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	4. Members' Capital (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	equity
	(each, a "Conversion Event"). Taking into consideration the conversion value attributable to the Class&nbsp;B and C units, and the one-time protection afforded to the Class&nbsp;D units
	against dilution resulting from the conversion of the Class&nbsp;B and C units, the following represents the three different conversion
	possibilities:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	In the event of a Conversion Event in which the valuation of the Company is at or below $41.7&nbsp;million, the Class&nbsp;B and C
	units would convert to Class&nbsp;A units such that the holders of these units would receive approximately 100% of the proceeds of such Conversion Event;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	In the event of a Conversion Event in which the valuation of the Company is greater than $41.7&nbsp;million but less than
	$45.8&nbsp;million, the Class&nbsp;B and C units would convert into Class&nbsp;A units such that the holders of these units would receive $41.7&nbsp;million of the proceeds of such Conversion
	Event. The proceeds in excess of $41.7&nbsp;million would be shared ratably by the other holders of Class&nbsp;A units. The Class&nbsp;D membership units would not convert into Class&nbsp;A
	units and would be deemed void; or
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	In the event of a Conversion Event in which the valuation of the Company is greater than $45.8&nbsp;million, the Class&nbsp;B and
	C units would convert into Class&nbsp;A units such that the holders thereof would receive $41.7&nbsp;million of the proceeds of such Conversion Event. The Class&nbsp;D units would convert into
	Class&nbsp;A units such that the holders thereof would receive $4.2&nbsp;million of such proceeds. The proceeds in excess of $45.8&nbsp;million would be shared ratably by the other holders of
	Class&nbsp;A units.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Valuation
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;To estimate certain expenses and record certain transactions, it is necessary for the Company to estimate the fair value of its
	membership units. Given the absence of a public trading market, and in accordance with the American Institute of Certified Public Accountants' Practice Guide, "Valuation of Privately-Held-Company
	Equity Securities Issued as Compensation", the Company exercised reasonable judgment and considered numerous objective and subjective factors to determine its best estimate of the fair value of its
	membership units. Factors considered included:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	recent equity financings and the related valuations;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	the estimated present value of the Company's future cash flows;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	industry information such as market size and growth;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	market capitalization of comparable companies and the estimated value of transactions such companies have engaged in; and
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	macroeconomic conditions.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Company updated the valuation of Class&nbsp;A membership units as of May&nbsp;31, 2014 using methodology consistent with prior valuations. At the time of the valuation, the
	Company's discounted cash flow forecasts were updated to reflect changes in market conditions. During this analysis, reduced weighting was placed upon the implied valuation of the Company's
	Ribasphere&reg; products with additional weighting being placed on the Company's product pipeline and implied valuation based on
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	F-28
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=7,SEQ=262,EFW="2229263",CP="KADMON HOLDINGS, LLC",DN="1",CHK=985004,FOLIO='F-28',FILE='DISK134:[15ZCV1.15ZCV70901]FO70901A.;22',USER='PJAMES',CD='18-JUL-2016;18:05' -->
<A NAME="A2229263ZS-1A_HTM_PAGE_FO70901_1_29">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2229263ZS-1A_HTM_BG70901A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	Kadmon Holdings,&nbsp;LLC and Subsidiaries
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Notes to consolidated financial statements (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	(unaudited as of March&nbsp;31, 2016 and for the three months ended March&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	4. Members' Capital (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	recent
	fundraising. As a result of the revised inputs to the analysis, the estimated fair value of each Class&nbsp;A membership unit was $7.00 as of May&nbsp;31, 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Company updated the valuation of Class&nbsp;A membership units as of October&nbsp;31, 2014 using methodology consistent with prior valuations. At the time of the valuation, the
	Company's discounted cash flow forecasts were updated to reflect changes in market conditions related to its Ribasphere&reg; products. At the time of the valuation, there was no significant
	change in the weighting of assumptions, however, the implied value of the Ribasphere&reg; products decreased based on the updated market conditions. The estimated fair value of each
	Class&nbsp;A membership unit was decreased to $6.00 as of October&nbsp;31, 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Company updated the valuation of Class&nbsp;A membership units as of September&nbsp;30, 2015 using methodology consistent with prior valuations. At the time of the valuation, the
	Company had issued $92.0&nbsp;million in second-lien convertible debt, and it was deemed appropriate to place additional weighting on this consideration, as compared to prior valuations. The Company
	also considered equity raised through the issuance of $15.0&nbsp;million in Class&nbsp;A membership units during 2015. The Company's assigned no value to the Ribasphere&reg; products to
	reflect changes in market conditions
	that have resulted in lower sales of the Ribasphere&reg; products. As a result of the revised inputs to the analysis, the estimated fair value of each Class&nbsp;A membership unit was
	decreased to $5.00 as of September&nbsp;30, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;No
	events have come to the attention of Company management between the date of the most recent valuation and the balance sheet date which would have a material impact on the per unit
	valuation of the Company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	5. Commercial Partnership
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On June&nbsp;17, 2013 the Company entered into a series of agreements with a commercial partner, AbbVie,&nbsp;Inc., whereby the Company issued a non-exclusive license for the
	domestic sale of Ribasphere&reg; and also sold certain intellectual property and marketing rights related to the international sale of Ribasphere&reg;. The Company received upfront
	payments totaling $64.0&nbsp;million, and could receive additional contingent payments totaling $51.0&nbsp;million based on the achievement of certain milestones. The Company earned and recognized
	$27.0&nbsp;million of such milestones during 2014, while no such milestones were earned during 2015 or the three months ended March&nbsp;31, 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	accordance with ASC 605-25-25-5, in an arrangement with multiple deliverables, the delivered item or items shall be considered a separate unit of accounting if both of the following
	criteria are met:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	1.
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	delivered item or items have value to the customer on a standalone basis. The item or items have value on a standalone basis if they are sold separately
	by any vendor or the customer could resell the delivered item(s) on a standalone basis. In the context of a customer's ability to resell the delivered item(s), this criterion does not require the
	existence of an observable market for the deliverable(s).
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	2.
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	If
	the arrangement includes a general right of return relative to the delivered item, delivery or performance of the undelivered item or items is considered
	probable and substantially in the control of the vendor.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	F-29
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=8,SEQ=263,EFW="2229263",CP="KADMON HOLDINGS, LLC",DN="1",CHK=949749,FOLIO='F-29',FILE='DISK134:[15ZCV1.15ZCV70901]FO70901A.;22',USER='PJAMES',CD='18-JUL-2016;18:05' -->
<UL>
<UL>
</UL>
</UL>
<!-- THIS IS THE END OF A COMPOSITION COMPONENT -->
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2229263ZS-1A_HTM_PAGE_FQ70901_1_30">
</A>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_BASECOLOR,"BLACK" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DEFAULTFONT,"FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TABLESHADECOLOR,"#CCEEFF" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_STABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DTABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:DOUBLE #000000 2.25PT;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_SCRTABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DCRTABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:DOUBLE #000000 2.25PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;" -->
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2229263ZS-1A_HTM_BG70901A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	Kadmon Holdings,&nbsp;LLC and Subsidiaries
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Notes to consolidated financial statements (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	(unaudited as of March&nbsp;31, 2016 and for the three months ended March&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	5. Commercial Partnership (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The upfront payments associated with the non-exclusive license agreement and the asset purchase agreement (sale of certain intellectual property and marketing rights related to the
	international sale of Ribasphere&reg;) were considered to be separate units of accounting as both criteria for separation were met, and were analyzed separately in order to determine the
	appropriate accounting treatment. The assigned fair value of the units of accounting in the transaction were determined by the Company's calculation of the discounted cash flows from the future
	revenue streams of both the non-exclusive domestic license of Ribasphere&reg; and the sale of the international intellectual property and marketing rights of Ribasphere&reg;.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Of
	the $64.0&nbsp;million upfront payment, $44.0&nbsp;million was considered allocable to the non-exclusive domestic licensing arrangement and was recorded as deferred revenue to be
	recognized over the 10&nbsp;year term of the agreement. The Company will recognize the upfront payment to revenue on a straight-line basis over the life of the agreement. The Company recognized
	$4.4&nbsp;million of the upfront consideration to license revenue during each of the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014 and $1.1&nbsp;million during each of the three months ended
	March&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015. As of March&nbsp;31, 2016, December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, $31.7&nbsp;million, $32.8&nbsp;million and $37.2&nbsp;million is recorded as deferred revenue,
	respectively, of which $4.4&nbsp;million is short-term.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Of
	the $64.0&nbsp;million upfront payment, $20.0&nbsp;million was considered allocable to the sale of international intellectual property and marketing rights. The assets sold were
	part of the intangible asset related to the Company's Ribasphere&reg; product rights. As this upfront payment meets the criteria of ASC 605-10 as of the date of the agreement, we consider the
	associated revenue to be realized and earned as of that date. As such, the Company decreased the net book value of the intangible asset as of June&nbsp;17, 2013 by the portion of the asset
	associated with the international marketing rights totaling $6.6&nbsp;million. The amount of the asset associated with the international marketing rights was determined based on the fair value of
	the expected cash flows in the respective territories. The remaining consideration was recognized as a $13.4&nbsp;million gain on divestiture of marketing rights in 2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	April 2014, the Company received a payment of $3.0&nbsp;million upon obtaining the regulatory approval of Ribasphere&reg; in Germany, which was recognized as milestone
	revenue. As the milestones meet the criteria defined in ASC 605-28, we will consider this guidance in assessing associated revenue recognition. Additionally, we will continually assess the
	applicability of the guidance for each milestone.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	May 2014, the Company entered into an amendment with AbbVie,&nbsp;Inc. whereby the Company issued a non-exclusive, royalty-free sublicense to develop and commercialize
	Ribasphere&reg;. The Company evaluated the terms of the amendment to its license agreement for the domestic sale of Ribasphere&reg; and issuance of a non-exclusive, royalty-free
	sublicense to develop and commercialize Ribasphere&reg; relative to the entire arrangement and determined the amendment to be a material modification to the original license agreement. In
	analyzing this material modification, the Company determined that there were no undelivered elements remaining from the original agreement as of the effective date of the amendment. The Company
	received an upfront payment totaling $5.0&nbsp;million which was recorded as milestone revenue as this component of the agreement represents the delivery of an executed sublicense agreement and not
	an upfront fee related to an ongoing servicing arrangement.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	October 2014, the Company entered into a series of amendments with AbbVie,&nbsp;Inc. whereby the Company agreed to eliminate all potential future unearned and unpaid milestones and
	also agreed
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	F-30
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=264,EFW="2229263",CP="KADMON HOLDINGS, LLC",DN="1",CHK=901197,FOLIO='F-30',FILE='DISK134:[15ZCV1.15ZCV70901]FQ70901A.;17',USER='CHE107325',CD='26-JUL-2016;02:50' -->
<A NAME="A2229263ZS-1A_HTM_PAGE_FQ70901_1_31">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2229263ZS-1A_HTM_BG70901A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	Kadmon Holdings,&nbsp;LLC and Subsidiaries
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Notes to consolidated financial statements (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	(unaudited as of March&nbsp;31, 2016 and for the three months ended March&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	5. Commercial Partnership (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	to
	a revised royalty structure for the sale of Ribasphere&reg; under the domestic license agreement. The Company received upfront payments of $6.0&nbsp;million in consideration of future
	royalties payable resulting from the resale of Ribasphere&reg; by AbbVie,&nbsp;Inc. during 2015 and 2016. At the time of receipt the balance was recorded to deferred revenue,
	$3.0&nbsp;million of which was recorded as short-term as it related to prepaid royalties for 2015 and $3.0&nbsp;million of which was recorded as long-term as it related to prepaid royalties for
	2016. The Company will recognize portions of the deferred revenue to income as Ribasphere&reg; is sold by AbbVie,&nbsp;Inc. The Company is entitled to receive additional compensation from
	AbbVie,&nbsp;Inc. for any royalties earned in excess of the annual prepayment. If royalties earned do not exceed the annual prepayment the Company is required to refund the excess to
	AbbVie,&nbsp;Inc.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Since
	the royalties earned from the resale of Ribasphere&reg; by AbbVie under the domestic license agreement did not exceed the $3.0&nbsp;million annual prepayment in 2015, the
	Company expects to refund approximately $2.1&nbsp;million of the prepaid royalty to AbbVie,&nbsp;Inc. Therefore the Company has recorded this amount as an accrued expense at March&nbsp;31, 2016
	and December&nbsp;31, 2015. Furthermore, the Company expects to refund approximately $2.9&nbsp;million of the prepaid royalty to AbbVie,&nbsp;Inc. resulting from the resale of
	Ribasphere&reg; by AbbVie,&nbsp;Inc. during 2016. Therefore, the Company has recorded this amount as an accrued expense at March&nbsp;31, 2016 and other long term liability at
	December&nbsp;31, 2015, as the refund is payable in March 2017.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
	part of the October 2014 amendment, the Company additionally received a payment totaling $19.0&nbsp;million which was considered allocable to the settlement of future milestones in
	the asset purchase agreement (sale of certain intellectual property and marketing rights related to the international sale of Ribasphere&reg;). The Company evaluated the terms of the amendment
	to its asset purchase agreement relative to the entire arrangement and determined the amendment to be a material modification to the original license agreement. In analyzing this material
	modification, the Company determined that there were no undelivered elements remaining from the original agreement as of the effective date of the amendment. The $19.0&nbsp;million was recognized as
	milestone revenue at the time of the amendment as this component of the agreement represents the delivery of an amendment and not an upfront fee related to an ongoing servicing arrangement.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Company has a continuing obligation to supply Ribasphere&reg;, maintain the marketing authorization for Ribasphere&reg; and maintain the intellectual property for
	Ribasphere&reg; through the term of the agreements ending December&nbsp;31, 2020.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	F-31
</FONT>
</P>
