<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	A.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Secured Term Debt
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
<U>
	2010 Secured Term Debt
</U>
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In October 2010, the Company entered into a secured term loan in the amount of $121.5&nbsp;million with a syndication of lenders
	("2010 Credit Agreement"). The borrowings were used to complete the October 2010 Acquisition and to provide additional working capital in support of the Company's growth. The interest rate on the loan
	was originally LIBOR plus 13% with a 2% floor. The Company incurred a 2% commitment fee in connection with the loan and was required to pay a 3% repayment fee on the maturity date of the loan. The
	basic terms of the loan required quarterly payments of interest only through the maturity date of the loan and required the Company to maintain certain financial covenants. Any outstanding balance of
	the loan and accrued interest was to be repaid on October&nbsp;22, 2011, unless the Company elected to extend the maturity date by one year. The secured term loan is secured by the tangible and
	intangible property of the Company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Company had entered into several amendments to the 2010 Credit Agreement. In October 2011, the Company entered into an Amended and Restated Credit Agreement ("Amended Credit
	Agreement"). In June 2013, the Company entered into the Second Amended Credit Agreement ("Second Amended Credit Agreement") and the First Amended and Restated Convertible Credit Agreement ("First
	Amended and Restated Convertible Credit Agreement"). In November 2014, the
	Company entered into the Third Amended Credit Agreement ("Third Amended Credit Agreement") and the Second Amended and Restated Convertible Credit Agreement ("Second Amended and Restated Convertible
	Credit Agreement").
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	F-32
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=266,EFW="2229263",CP="KADMON HOLDINGS, LLC",DN="1",CHK=991906,FOLIO='F-32',FILE='DISK134:[15ZCV1.15ZCV70901]FQ70901A.;17',USER='CHE107325',CD='26-JUL-2016;02:50' -->
<A NAME="A2229263ZS-1A_HTM_PAGE_FQ70901_1_33">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2229263ZS-1A_HTM_BG70901A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	Kadmon Holdings,&nbsp;LLC and Subsidiaries
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Notes to consolidated financial statements (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	(unaudited as of March&nbsp;31, 2016 and for the three months ended March&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	6. Debt (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
<U>
	2013 Second Amended Secured Term Debt
</U>
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In June 2013, the Company amended and restated the Amended Credit Agreement ("Second Amended Credit Agreement"), replacing certain
	existing lenders. The Second Amended Credit Agreement had a three year term, under which the total borrowings were $130.0&nbsp;million. In the first year of the agreement, interest accrued at a rate
	of 17%, 5% of which was payable quarterly in cash and 12% of which was paid-in-kind quarterly as an increase of principal. Subsequent to the first year, interest was to accrue at a rate of 11%, all of
	which was payable in cash. The Company also issued three tranches of warrants that can be exercised for Class&nbsp;A units (Note&nbsp;7). The Company incurred approximately $4.0&nbsp;million in
	debt issuance costs, inclusive of the fair value of the warrants, which were recorded as a debt discount and was being amortized over the life of the outstanding term loan using the effective interest
	method. The Company utilized a Black-Scholes calculation to measure the first and second tranche of warrants (utilizing the following assumptions: dividend yield of 0%, risk free rate of $0.27%,
	volatility of 48.32% and an expected life of 2&nbsp;years) and a bi-nominal model to measure the third warrant tranche (utilizing the following assumptions: dividend yield of 0%, risk free rate of
	$0.38%, volatility of 48.88% and an expected life of 2.5&nbsp;years).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Deferred
	financing costs of $4.1&nbsp;million were recognized in recording the Second Amended Credit Agreement and were to be amortized to interest expense over the three year term of
	the agreement. In connection with this transaction, fees paid to existing creditors, inclusive of financial instruments issued (Note&nbsp;7), of $9.0&nbsp;million were charged to loss on
	extinguishment of debt in accordance with FASB ASC Topic 470-50 "Debt Modifications and Extinguishments" ("ASC 470"). The Company incurred $4.0&nbsp;million in debt issuance costs to new creditors,
	inclusive of financial instruments issued (Note&nbsp;7), which were recorded as a debt discount being amortized to interest expense over the agreement's three year term.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	the event the Company received a contingent payment from its commercial partner, Abbvie,&nbsp;Inc. (Note&nbsp;5), the lenders could have elected to require a mandatory debt
	prepayment equal to one-half of the balance received. The lenders had the ability to defer their decision to require a mandatory prepayment until the third quarter of 2014. The lenders did not elect
	to require such prepayment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	December 2013, the Company amended the Second Amended Credit Agreement. The amendment to the Second Amended Credit Agreement adjusted certain required covenant levels to allow for an
	additional $13.5&nbsp;million of convertible debt (see "December 2013 First Amended Convertible Debt"). Cash fees paid to third parties totaling $335,000 were recorded to interest expense and cash
	fees paid to lenders totaling $270,000 were recorded as a debt discount.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	March 2014 the Second Amended Credit Agreement was amended to delay a scheduled $6.5&nbsp;million principal payment from March&nbsp;31, 2014 to April&nbsp;30, 2014. No fees
	resulted from this amendment and the principal payment was not made on April&nbsp;30, 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	May 2014 a waiver was obtained on certain covenants in the Second Amended Credit Agreement and First Amended and Restated Convertible Credit Agreement which the Company was in
	violation of as of April&nbsp;30, 2014. The Second Amended Credit Agreement was amended to delay a scheduled $6.5&nbsp;million principal payment from April&nbsp;30, 2014 to May&nbsp;30, 2014
	and a scheduled
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	F-33
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=267,EFW="2229263",CP="KADMON HOLDINGS, LLC",DN="1",CHK=575620,FOLIO='F-33',FILE='DISK134:[15ZCV1.15ZCV70901]FQ70901A.;17',USER='CHE107325',CD='26-JUL-2016;02:50' -->
<A NAME="A2229263ZS-1A_HTM_PAGE_FQ70901_1_34">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2229263ZS-1A_HTM_BG70901A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	Kadmon Holdings,&nbsp;LLC and Subsidiaries
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Notes to consolidated financial statements (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	(unaudited as of March&nbsp;31, 2016 and for the three months ended March&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	6. Debt (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	$1.5&nbsp;million
	principal payment from April&nbsp;2, 2014 to May&nbsp;30, 2014. No fees resulted from this amendment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	June 2014 the Second Amended Credit Agreement was amended to delay a scheduled $6.5&nbsp;million principal payment from April&nbsp;30, 2014 to June&nbsp;17, 2014 and a scheduled
	$1.5&nbsp;million principal payment from April&nbsp;2, 2014 to June&nbsp;17, 2014. The amendment also allowed for a delay in the delivery of the Company's audit report for Fiscal Year 2013 to
	May&nbsp;3, 2014. No fees resulted from this amendment. The Company's audit report was delivered on May&nbsp;3, 2014 and the Company deposited $8.0&nbsp;million into a restricted cash account on
	June&nbsp;13, 2014. Subsequently, the $8.0&nbsp;million principal payment was made in October 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
<U>
	November 2014 Third Amended Secured Term Debt
</U>
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In November 2014, the Company amended and restated the Second Amended Credit Agreement ("Third Amended Credit Agreement"), the First
	Amended and Restated Convertible Credit Agreement ("Second Amended and Restated Convertible Credit Agreement") and all three tranches of warrants with the original issue date of June&nbsp;17, 2013
	(Note&nbsp;7), with the same
	parties as the Second Amended Credit Agreement. The Third Amended Credit Agreement was secured by the tangible and intangible property of the Company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Under
	the terms of the Third Amended Credit Agreement, the Company paid $32.6&nbsp;million of principal which decreased the outstanding principal balance to $110.2&nbsp;million and
	extended the maturity date to December&nbsp;17, 2016. The Company was required to make quarterly principal payments in the amount of $3.0&nbsp;million beginning December&nbsp;31, 2014 through
	the maturity date. From November&nbsp;26, 2014 through September&nbsp;30, 2015, interest on the Third Amended Credit Agreement accrued at a rate of 9.75% and a rate of 14% thereafter, payable
	quarterly. Repayment premiums on principal payments other than the scheduled quarterly principal payments were to begin to accrue beginning October&nbsp;1, 2015 at the rate of 2% on the principal
	amount of the loan, escalating quarterly to 10% after September&nbsp;30, 2016. Minimum liquidity of $3.0&nbsp;million was required at the Kadmon Pharmaceuticals subsidiary for the term of the
	Third Amended Credit Agreement. Under certain circumstances the Company was required to make mandatory prepayments of debt principal based on operating cash flows of the commercial business. No such
	prepayments were triggered during 2015 and 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Deferred
	financing costs of $47,000 were recognized in recording the Third Amended Credit Agreement and were to be amortized to interest expense over the remaining term of the agreement.
	Under the terms of the Second Amended and Restated Convertible Credit Agreement (section&nbsp;B below), the Company incurred a $10.0&nbsp;million fee payable to the lenders through an increase to
	the principal balance of the convertible debt by the same amount. A portion of the fee was allocated to the Third Amended Credit Agreement based on total outstanding principal balances at the time of
	the amendments. The Company incurred $4.5&nbsp;million in debt issuance costs to two lenders, inclusive of financial instruments issued (Note&nbsp;7), which were recorded as a debt discount and
	are being amortized to interest expense over the remaining term of the agreement as the amendment was deemed a modification in accordance with ASC 470. Additionally, fees paid to one other creditor,
	inclusive of financial instruments issued (Note&nbsp;7), of $3.0&nbsp;million were charged to loss on extinguishment of debt in accordance with ASC 470. There was also $639,000 of previously
	recognized debt discount and $650,000
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	F-34
</FONT>
</P>

</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	of
	previously recognized deferred financing cost write-offs charged to loss on extinguishment of debt in accordance with ASC 470 in connection with this transaction.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Third Amended Credit Agreement and Second Amended and Restated Convertible Credit Agreement contain reporting and financial covenants pertaining to Kadmon Pharmaceuticals, including
	minimum sales, minimum fixed charge coverage ratio, maximum leverage ratio, maximum capital and research and development expenditures, and a minimum adjusted EBITDA.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	June and July 2015, the Company entered into the third and fourth amendments to the Third Amended Credit Agreement, which deferred the $3.0&nbsp;million principal payment due
	June&nbsp;30, 2015 to July&nbsp;15, 2015 and July&nbsp;31, 2015, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	August 2015, the Company entered into a Waiver Agreement to the Third Amended Credit Agreement ("Waiver"), which deferred the $3.0&nbsp;million principal payment due July&nbsp;31,
	2015 to August&nbsp;14, 2015 and may be extended at the Company's request to August&nbsp;28, 2015. The Waiver also waived specific defaults that occurred on July&nbsp;31, 2015, including failure
	to maintain a minimum Consolidated EBITDA and debt to EBITDA ratio, until August&nbsp;14, 2015 and may be extended at the Company's request to August&nbsp;28, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	August 2015, the Third Amended Credit Agreement was repaid in full through the partial use of proceeds from the issuance of secured term debt and second-lien convertible credit
	agreement in August 2015. As a result, the remaining debt discount totaling $3.7&nbsp;million and deferred financings costs totaling $950,000 was expensed. There was $1.5&nbsp;million of debt
	discount and $390,000 of deferred financing cost write-offs charged to loss on extinguishment of debt in accordance with ASC 470 and the remaining amounts were charged to interest expense.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	B.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2013 Convertible Debt
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
<U>
	June 2013 Convertible Debt
</U>
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In June 2013, in conjunction with the Second Amended Credit Agreement, the Company entered into a senior secured convertible credit
	agreement ("Convertible Debt Agreement"), with the same parties as the Second Amended Credit Agreement. The Convertible Debt Agreement has a five year term under which the total borrowings are
	$35.0&nbsp;million. Interest is calculated at a rate of 10% and payable-in-kind quarterly as an increase of principal. As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, all accrued interest was added to the principal
	balance. The debt is secured by the tangible and intangible property of the Company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Holders
	of the Convertible Debt Agreement may elect to convert any portion of principal in increments of $1.0&nbsp;million to Class&nbsp;A membership units at any time. The initial
	conversion price is $18.00 per Class&nbsp;A unit. The holders may additionally receive a premium on their conversion option should certain events involving the Company's capital structure occur.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Deferred
	financing costs of $1.6&nbsp;million were recognized in recording the Convertible Debt Agreement and will be amortized to interest expense over the five year term of the
	agreement. Unamortized Deferred financing costs were $1.5&nbsp;million at December&nbsp;31, 2013, as $175,000 was charged to expense in 2013. In connection with this transaction, fees paid to
	existing creditors of $1.7&nbsp;million were charged to loss on extinguishment of debt in accordance with ASC 470. The
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	6. Debt (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Company
	incurred $196,000 in debt issuance costs to new creditors, which were recorded as a debt discount being amortized to interest expense over the five year term.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Company considered ASC 480, "Distinguishing Liabilities from Equity", and determined that the Convertible Debt Agreement does not contain any of the criteria under this guidance. The
	Convertible Debt Agreement represents the host contract and the option to convert the debt into the Company's Class&nbsp;A units represents the embedded conversion option. Since the conversion
	option meets the criteria under ASC 815, the conversion option does not require bifurcation and is not accounted for as a derivative under ASC 815.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Convertible Debt Agreement previously contained reporting and financial covenants pertaining to Kadmon Pharmaceuticals, including minimum sales, minimum fixed charge coverage ratio,
	maximum leverage ratio, maximum capital and research and development expenditures, and a minimum adjusted EBITDA.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
<U>
	December 2013 First Amended Convertible Debt
</U>
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In December 2013, the Company amended and restated the Convertible Debt Agreement ("First Amended and Restated Convertible Credit
	Agreement"). The balance related to the Convertible Debt Agreement was increased by $13.5&nbsp;million with identical interest and conversion provisions as the Convertible Debt Agreement. The
	amendment to the Second Amended Credit Agreement adjusted certain required covenant levels, to allow for the additional debt. The First Amended and Restated Convertible Credit Agreement was accounted
	for as a debt modification under ASC 470.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	First Amended and Restated Convertible Credit Agreement triggered certain contingent features of the warrants issued on June&nbsp;17, 2013 in conjunction with the Second Amended
	Credit Agreement, resulting in the issuance of 48,710 additional Class&nbsp;A unit warrants with an estimated fair value of $126,000, of which $91,000 was recorded as a debt discount and $35,000 was
	recorded to interest expense (Note&nbsp;7).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
<U>
	November 2014 Second Amended Convertible Debt
</U>
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Under the terms of the Second Amended and Restated Convertible Credit Agreement, the Company incurred a $10.0&nbsp;million fee
	payable to the lenders through an increase to the principal balance by the same amount. A portion of this fee was allocated to the Third Amended Credit Agreement based on total outstanding principal
	balances at the time of the amendments. No changes were made to the interest rate or term of the loan. The conversion price of this loan was amended to be the lesser of $12.00 per unit or discounted
	at 84.75% of the Class&nbsp;A membership unit price at the time of an initial public offering.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Deferred
	financing costs of $4,000 were recognized in recording the Second Amended and Restated Convertible Credit Agreement and will be amortized to interest expense over the five year
	term of the agreement. As a result of this amendment, $3.5&nbsp;million was recorded as a debt discount and is being amortized to interest expense over the remaining term of the agreement as the
	amendment was deemed a modification in accordance with ASC 470 for two creditors. Additionally, fees paid to one other creditor, inclusive of financial instruments issued (Note&nbsp;7) of $245,000
	was charged to loss on extinguishment of debt in accordance with ASC 470. There was also $19,000 of debt
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	discount
	and $51,000 of deferred financing cost write-offs charged to loss on extinguishment of debt in accordance with ASC 470 in connection with this transaction.
</FONT>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
<U>
	August 2015 Third Amended Convertible Debt
</U>
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Under the terms of the Third Amended and Restated Convertible Credit Agreement, the Company was permitted to enter into the 2015 Credit
	Agreement and a Second-Lien Convertible Debt Agreement. Most of the reporting and financial covenants pertaining to Kadmon Pharmaceuticals that were previously required were removed so that the
	Company only needs to maintain a minimum liquidity amount. Beginning after June&nbsp;30, 2016, the Company will also need to meet a minimum revenue requirement. In August 2015, the Company further
	amended the terms of the Third Amended and Restated Convertible Credit Agreement to provide for, among other things, a $69.1&nbsp;million term loan which matures on June&nbsp;17, 2018. As
	consideration for the amendment, if a qualified IPO, defined as a public offering of the Company's equity interests with gross proceeds to the Company of at least $75.0&nbsp;million, has not been
	completed on or prior to March&nbsp;31, 2016, the Company agreed to pay an amendment fee equal to $1.3&nbsp;million to be allocated among the lenders. This fee was paid in April 2016, as the
	Company did not complete a qualified IPO by this date. As a result of this amendment, $1.3&nbsp;million was recorded as a debt discount at September&nbsp;30, 2015 and is being amortized to
	interest expense over the remaining term of the agreement as the amendment was deemed a modification in accordance with ASC 470.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Company was in compliance with all amended covenants as of December&nbsp;31, 2015 and March&nbsp;31, 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	C.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Secured Term Debt
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
<U>
	August 2015 Secured Term Debt
</U>
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In August 2015, the Company entered into a secured term loan in the amount of $35.0&nbsp;million with two lenders ("2015 Credit
	Agreement"). The borrowings were used to repay the 2010 Credit Agreement and to provide additional working capital in support of the Company's growth. The interest rate on the loan is LIBOR plus
	9.375% with a 1% floor. The Company incurred and paid a $788,000 commitment fee in connection with the loan that will be amortized to interest expense over the term of the agreement. The basic terms
	of the loan require monthly payments of interest only through the first anniversary date of the loan and require the Company to maintain certain financial covenants requiring the Company to maintain a
	minimum liquidity amount and minimum revenue levels beginning after June&nbsp;30, 2016. Beginning on the first
	anniversary date of the loan, the Company will be required to make monthly principal payments in the amount of $380,000. Any outstanding balance of the loan and accrued interest is to be repaid on
	June&nbsp;17, 2018. The secured term loan is secured by the tangible and intangible property of the Company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	conjunction with 2015 Credit Agreement, warrants to purchase $6.3&nbsp;million of Class&nbsp;A units were issued to two lenders, of which $5.4&nbsp;million was recorded as a
	debt discount and $900,000 was recorded as loss on extinguishment of debt (Note&nbsp;7). The debt discount is being amortized over the life of the outstanding term loan using the effective interest
	method.
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	6. Debt (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Deferred
	financing costs of $1.3&nbsp;million were recognized in recording the 2015 Credit Agreement and will be amortized to interest expense over the three year term of the
	agreement. Additionally, a fee paid to one existing lender of $113,000 was charged to loss on extinguishment of debt in accordance with ASC 470. There was also $1.5&nbsp;million of debt discount and
	$390,000 of deferred financing cost write-offs charged to loss on extinguishment of debt in accordance with ASC 470 in connection with this transaction. Unamortized deferred financing costs were
	$1.0&nbsp;million and $1.1&nbsp;million at March&nbsp;31, 2016 and December&nbsp;31, 2015, respectively, as $0.1&nbsp;million and $0.2&nbsp;million was charged to interest expense during
	the first three months of 2016 and the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	D.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2015 Second-Lien Convertible Debt
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
<U>
	August 2015 Second-Lien Convertible Debt
</U>
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In August 2015, in conjunction with the 2015 Credit Agreement, the Company incurred indebtedness pursuant to its offering second-lien
	convertible PIK notes ("Second-Lien Convert"), with a syndicate of lenders including the same two parties as the 2015 Credit Agreement. The Second-Lien Convert has a four year term under which the
	initial borrowings were $94.3&nbsp;million, including $2.3&nbsp;million in third party fees that was settled through the issuance of Second-Lien Convert. In October 2015 and November 2015, the
	Company borrowed an additional $5.5&nbsp;million and $15.0&nbsp;million, respectively, and incurred $0.4&nbsp;million in transaction costs under the
	Second-Lien Convert with three additional lenders bringing the total borrowings under the Second-Lien Convert to $114.8&nbsp;million, including $2.3&nbsp;million in third party fees. Interest is
	calculated at a rate of 13.0% and payable-in-kind semi-annually as an increase of principal. If the Company has not consummated an initial public offering of not less than $50.0&nbsp;million and
	listed on a national stock exchange ("Qualified IPO") on or before March&nbsp;31, 2016, the interest rate shall automatically increase on April&nbsp;1, 2016 by an additional 3.0% and the interest
	rate shall subsequently increase by an additional 3.0% on each October&nbsp;1 and April&nbsp;1 until the interest rate equals 21.0% per annum, which shall remain the applicable interest rate so
	long as the Second-Lien Convert remains outstanding. As of March&nbsp;31, 2016, the Company has not completed a qualified IPO. As of March&nbsp;31, 2016 and December&nbsp;31, 2015, all accrued
	interest was added to the principal balance. The debt is secured by the tangible and intangible property of the Company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Holders
	of the Second-Lien Convert may elect to convert any portion of principal to Class&nbsp;A units at any time following the Company's consummation of a Qualified IPO. The
	conversion price shall be equal to the product of (x)&nbsp;90% and (y)&nbsp;the price per Class&nbsp;A Unit of the Company offered in a Qualified IPO provided, however, that the conversion price
	shall be capped at $12.00. The Company may redeem the Second-Lien Convert at its option, in whole or in part, at any time on or after the later of (x)&nbsp;the first anniversary of the issue date
	and (y)&nbsp;the date of the consummation of a Qualified IPO, at a redemption price of 150.0% of the principal amount, plus accrued and unpaid interest payable (at the Company's option) in cash or
	Class&nbsp;A Units. In addition, on or after the later of (x)&nbsp;the third anniversary of the issue date and (y)&nbsp;the date of the consummation of a Qualified IPO, the Company may redeem
	the Second-Lien Convert at its option, in whole or in part, at a redemption price in cash of 110.0% of the principal amount, plus accrued and unpaid interest.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Deferred
	financing costs of $4.2&nbsp;million were recognized in recording the Second-Lien Convert and will be amortized to interest expense over the four year term of the agreement.
	Unamortized deferred
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	F-38
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=9,SEQ=272,EFW="2229263",CP="KADMON HOLDINGS, LLC",DN="1",CHK=1004529,FOLIO='F-38',FILE='DISK134:[15ZCV1.15ZCV70901]FQ70901A.;17',USER='CHE107325',CD='26-JUL-2016;02:50' -->
<A NAME="A2229263ZS-1A_HTM_PAGE_FQ70901_1_39">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2229263ZS-1A_HTM_BG70901A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	Kadmon Holdings,&nbsp;LLC and Subsidiaries
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Notes to consolidated financial statements (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	(unaudited as of March&nbsp;31, 2016 and for the three months ended March&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	6. Debt (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	financing
	costs were $3.6&nbsp;million and $3.9&nbsp;million at March&nbsp;31, 2016 and December&nbsp;31, 2015, as $0.3&nbsp;million was charged to expense in both 2015 and in the first
	three months of 2016. The Company incurred $52,000 in debt issuance costs to new creditors, which were recorded as a debt discount and is being amortized to interest expense over the four year term.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Company considered ASC 480, "Distinguishing Liabilities from Equity", and determined that the Second-Lien Convert does not contain any of the criteria under this guidance. In
	accordance with ASC 815, the Company determined that the interest rate increase and put/redemption feature do not require bifurcation since the embedded interest rate increase, if freestanding, would
	not qualify as a derivative. The Second-Lien Convert represents the host contract and the option to convert the debt into the Company's Class&nbsp;A units represents the embedded conversion option.
	Since the conversion option meets the criteria under ASC 815, the conversion option does not require bifurcation and is not accounted for as a derivative under ASC 815.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Company was in compliance with all covenants as of March&nbsp;31, 2016, December&nbsp;31, 2015 and December&nbsp;31, 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	minimum payments required on the outstanding balances of the 2015 Credit Agreement, Third Amended and Restated Convertible Credit Agreement and Second-Lien Convert as of
	December&nbsp;31, 2015 are (in thousands):
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	7. Financial Instruments
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Success Fee
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In association with the 2011 Amended Credit Agreement (Note&nbsp;6) an executive officer and member issued an equity instrument for
	which the underlying value is based on 536,065 Class&nbsp;A membership units. The intrinsic value of the instrument is redeemable for cash upon certain defined liquidity or distribution events
	("Success Fee"). No cash settlements associated with these instruments have occurred as of March&nbsp;31, 2016 and December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
	there are no quoted prices for identical or similar instruments, the Company has utilized a Black-Scholes calculation to value this instrument as of each balance sheet date, based on
	the following assumptions:
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_45"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;WIDTH:70%;MARGIN-LEFT:15%;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
</FONT>
</P>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TABLEWIDTH,"100%" -->
<!-- USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR>
<!-- TABLE COLUMN WIDTHS SET -->

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A
	liability was recorded based on the instrument's fair value of $15,000, $69,000 and $275,000 at March&nbsp;31, 2016, December&nbsp;31, 2015 and December&nbsp;31, 2014,
	respectively. As a result of marking this instrument to market, the Company recorded ($206,000) and ($888,000) to change in fair value of financial instruments for the years ended December&nbsp;31,
	2015 and 2014, respectively, and ($54,000) and ($144,000) to change in fair value of financial instruments for the three months ended March&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Equity issued pursuant to Credit Agreements
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In connection with the Second Amended Credit Agreement in June 2013, the Company issued three tranches of warrants as fees to the
	lenders which are redeemable for Class&nbsp;A units. In the
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	F-40
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>

<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=274,EFW="2229263",CP="KADMON HOLDINGS, LLC",DN="1",CHK=268286,FOLIO='F-40',FILE='DISK134:[15ZCV1.15ZCV70901]FS70901A.;20',USER='PJAMES',CD='18-JUL-2016;18:05' -->
<A NAME="A2229263ZS-1A_HTM_PAGE_FS70901_1_41">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2229263ZS-1A_HTM_BG70901A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	Kadmon Holdings,&nbsp;LLC and Subsidiaries
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Notes to consolidated financial statements (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	(unaudited as of March&nbsp;31, 2016 and for the three months ended March&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	7. Financial Instruments (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	aggregate,
	the first warrant tranche is redeemable for 1,119,618 Class&nbsp;A membership units at a strike price of $10.00 and exercisable as of the date of issuance. In the aggregate, the second
	warrant tranche is exercisable for 559,810 Class&nbsp;A membership units at a strike price of $13.75 and exercisable as of the date of issuance. In the aggregate, the third tranche is exercisable
	for 559,810 Class&nbsp;A membership units at a strike price of $16.50. The third warrant tranche is not exercisable until December&nbsp;17, 2015, and will vest only if there are outstanding
	obligations under the Second Amended Credit Agreement, and contains a provision whereby the exercise price may decrease based on certain potential future events. All three warrant tranches contain a
	fixed number of units exercisable as of March&nbsp;31, 2016 and December&nbsp;31, 2015. The warrants issued to existing lenders were recorded to loss on extinguishment of debt and warrants issued
	to new creditors were recorded as a debt discount and will be amortized over the three year term (Note&nbsp;6) in accordance with ASC 470.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	December 2013 First Amended and Restated Convertible Credit Agreement effectively resulted in the issuance of an additional 24,356, 12,177 and 12,177 of the first, second and third
	tranches of these warrants, respectively. The portion of the estimated fair value of these warrants which were issued to lenders that increased their principal balance in December 2013 was recorded as
	a debt discount to be amortized over the remaining term of the First Amended and Restated Convertible Credit Agreement, the portion of the estimated fair value of these warrants which was issued to
	lenders that did not increase their principal balance in December 2013 was recorded to interest expense (Note&nbsp;6).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;At
	the time the warrants were issued in June 2013, all three tranches were accounted for as a liability with changes in fair value being recorded to change in fair value of financial
	instruments. In June 2014, the variable unit provision in all three warrant tranche agreements expired. This resulted in the fair value of these warrants, amounting to $447,000 as of that date, being
	reclassified from liability to equity. The Company continued to account for tranche&nbsp;3 as a liability due to the variable price feature contained in the instrument.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	November 2014, under the terms of the Third Amended Credit Agreement, the strike price in all three tranches of warrants held by the lenders was amended to be the lower of $9.50 per
	unit or 85% of a future IPO price. In addition, the tranche&nbsp;3 warrants were vested immediately. As the price for all tranches becomes variable as of the date of the Third Amended Credit
	Agreement as the strike price does not become fixed before an IPO, all three tranches of warrants will be recorded as a liability through IPO conversion with changes in fair value being recorded to
	change in fair value of financial instruments. Upon conversion, the fair value of the liability at that date will be reclassified from liability to equity.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
	a result of this amendment, the tranche&nbsp;1 and 2 warrants were reclassified from equity to liability in the amount of $596,000 and the tranche&nbsp;3 warrants were
	reclassified from long term to short term liability in the amount of $931,000. As a result of the change in fair value of the warrants, $415,000 was charged to loss on extinguishment of debt in
	accordance with ASC 470 and $782,000 was charged to debt discount and will be amortized over the remaining term of the debt during the fourth quarter of 2014. The aggregate fair value of the warrants
	was $1.8&nbsp;million, $1.9&nbsp;million and $3.2&nbsp;million at March&nbsp;31, 2016, December&nbsp;31, 2015 and December&nbsp;31, 2014, respectively. The change in fair value of the
	warrants was ($1.3) million and $4.1&nbsp;million for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014,
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	F-41
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>

	and ($0.1) million and ($0.6) million for the three months ended March&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015, respectively.

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
	of March&nbsp;31, 2016, December&nbsp;31, 2015, December&nbsp;31, 2014 and November&nbsp;26, 2014 the Company utilized a binomial model to measure all three warrant tranches.
	Due to the uncertainty of the strike price of the warrants, the Company performed each calculation multiple times using a weighted number of units exercisable based on the Company's best estimate of
	how many units will be issuable. The inputs used in the calculations to measure all three warrant tranches as of the dates of issuance and the balance sheet dates are as follows:

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	connection with the 2015 Credit Agreement, the Company issued warrants as fees to the lenders to purchase an aggregate of $6.3&nbsp;million of the Company's Class&nbsp;A units.
	The strike price of the warrants is 85% of the price per unit in an IPO or, if before an IPO, 85% of the deemed per unit equity value as defined in the 2015 Credit Agreement. The warrants are
	exercisable as of the earlier of an IPO or July&nbsp;1, 2016. Since these warrants are also redeemable at the option of the holder after the 51st month from the issue date, they are recorded as a
	liability as of March&nbsp;31, 2016 and December&nbsp;31, 2015. Upon consummation of the agreement in 2015, the warrants issued to an existing lender was recorded to loss on extinguishment of debt
	of $900,000 and the warrants issued to the new lender was recorded as a debt discount of $5.4&nbsp;million and will be amortized over the three year term (Note&nbsp;6) in accordance with ASC 470.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;None
	of these instruments have been exercised as of March&nbsp;31, 2016 and December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Other Warrants
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On April&nbsp;16, 2013, the Company issued warrants with an estimated fair value of $1.4&nbsp;million for the purchase of 300,000
	Class&nbsp;A membership units at a strike price of $21.24 as consideration for fundraising efforts performed. None of these warrants have been exercised as of March&nbsp;31, 2016 and
	December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Fair Value of Long-term Debt
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As of March&nbsp;31, 2016 the Company maintained long-term secured term debt and long-term convertible debt balances of
	$25.8&nbsp;million and $189.7&nbsp;million, respectively. As of December&nbsp;31, 2015 the Company maintained long-term secured term debt and long-term convertible debt balances of
	$26.3&nbsp;million and $183.5&nbsp;million, respectively. As of December&nbsp;31, 2014 the Company maintained long-term secured term debt and long-term convertible debt balances of
	$88.5&nbsp;million and
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	F-42
</FONT>
</P>

	$60.9&nbsp;million,
	respectively. The underlying agreements for these balances were negotiated with parties that included fully independent third parties, at an interest rate which is considered to
	be in line with over-arching market conditions. Based on these factors management considers the carrying value of the debt to approximate fair value as of March&nbsp;31, 2016, December&nbsp;31,

<FONT SIZE=2>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Leasehold improvements

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Depreciation
	and amortization of fixed assets totaled $2.3&nbsp;million and $2.6&nbsp;million in each of the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, respectively, and
	$0.6&nbsp;million in each of the three months ended March&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	construction-in-progress balance was related to costs of unimplemented software still under development. Unamortized computer software costs were $1.2&nbsp;million,
	$1.3&nbsp;million and $2.0&nbsp;million at March&nbsp;31, 2016, December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, respectively. The amortization of computer software costs amounted to $720,000 and $324,000
	during the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, respectively, and $180,000 and $178,000 during the three months ended March&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	9. Goodwill and Other Intangible Assets
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The changes in the carrying amount of goodwill and other amortizable intangible assets for the years ended March&nbsp;31, 2016, December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014 are as follows (in
	thousands):
</FONT>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	connection with the acquisition of Kadmon Pharmaceuticals,&nbsp;LLC, formerly known as Three Rivers Pharmaceuticals,&nbsp;LLC in October 2010, the Company acquired intangible
	assets of $149.7&nbsp;million related to the estimated fair value of Ribasphere&reg; product rights, which product rights included regulatory marketing rights, product licenses and patents.
	The Company also acquired goodwill in connection with this transaction.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Ribasphere&reg;
	product rights were capitalized and were being amortized over 10&nbsp;years; however, during June 2014, the Company determined that the actual lives of the
	Ribasphere&reg; product rights intangible asset was shorter than the estimated useful lives used for amortization purposes in the Company's financial statements due to the emergence of
	competitor products that do not necessitate the use of Ribasphere&reg; as a compliment in treating hepatitis C infection. As a result, effective July&nbsp;1, 2014, the Company changed its
	estimate of the useful life of its Ribasphere&reg; product rights intangible asset to three years to better reflect the estimated period during which the asset will generate cash flows.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	September 2015, the Company reviewed the estimated useful life of the Ribasphere&reg; product rights and determined that the actual lives of the Ribasphere&reg;
	product rights intangible asset was shorter than the estimated useful lives used for amortization purposes in the Company's financial statements due to the continued growth of competitor products that
	do not necessitate the use of Ribasphere&reg; as a compliment in treating the hepatitis C infection. As a result, effective September&nbsp;30, 2015, the Company changed its estimate of the
	useful life of its Ribasphere&reg; product rights intangible asset to 1.25&nbsp;years to better reflect the estimated period during which the remaining asset will generate cash flows. The
	Company also determined that the estimated fair value of the Ribasphere&reg; product rights was impaired and recorded an impairment loss of $31.3&nbsp;million in September 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	October 2015, the Company determined that the proportional performance method of amortization is more appropriate than straight-line amortization. The amortization of the intangible
	based on the consumption of the economic benefit (Ribasphere&reg; gross profit), is now a reliably determinable method of amortization due to the remaining asset useful life being only
	1&nbsp;year and the ability to more accurately forecast the Ribasphere&reg; market. Accordingly, Kadmon will amortize the remaining book value of the intangible asset utilizing the
	proportional performance method starting October&nbsp;1, 2015 and ending December&nbsp;31, 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Amortization
	expense is included within selling, general and administrative expenses on the Company's consolidated statements of operations. The Company recorded amortization expense
	related to the intangible asset of $27.4&nbsp;million and $21.8&nbsp;million for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, respectively, and $5.6&nbsp;million and $7.4&nbsp;million
	for the three months ended March&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015, respectively. The accumulated amortization of the intangible asset was $131.1&nbsp;million, $125.5&nbsp;million and $66.8&nbsp;million
	as of March&nbsp;31, 2016, December&nbsp;31, 2015 and December&nbsp;31, 2014,
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	F-45
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

	Table of Contents

<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	Kadmon Holdings,&nbsp;LLC and Subsidiaries
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Notes to consolidated financial statements (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	(unaudited as of March&nbsp;31, 2016 and for the three months ended March&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	9. Goodwill and Other Intangible Assets (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	respectively.
	The remaining $9.7&nbsp;million balance in the intangible asset as of March&nbsp;31, 2016 will be amortized on a proportional performance method basis through December 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	10. License Agreements
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Yale University
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On February&nbsp;4, 2011, the Company entered into a license agreement with Yale University, whereby the Company obtained the
	worldwide exclusive license and right to make, use, sell, import and export PHY906, a development stage botanical compound, and the related technology. Under the license agreement, the Company paid an
	upfront fee of $209,000 and was required to pay Yale University an annual license maintenance fee of $50,000 beginning in 2015, escalating to $100,000 in 2017 and all subsequent years during the term
	of the license, until single digit royalties based on gross sales of PHY906 are payable. The Company was also required to make other payments totaling $92.0&nbsp;million to Yale University that are
	contingent on the achievement of certain milestones, such as receiving certain government approvals and commencing certain clinical trials.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
	part of the agreement, the Company had agreed to spend no less than $2.0&nbsp;million annually in a reasonable commercial effort to obtain the first sale of a licensed product. In
	the event the Company does not comply with this requirement, Yale University maintains the right to terminate the license. No milestones or sales related to this arrangement were achieved as of
	March&nbsp;31, 2016 and December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	April 2016, the Company entered into a mutual termination agreement with Yale University. All rights and licenses granted under the agreement were immediately terminated and shall
	revert to the party granting such rights.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
	August&nbsp;13, 2010, the Company entered into a license agreement with Symphony Evolution,&nbsp;Inc. ("Symphony") whereby the Company obtained from Symphony the worldwide
	exclusive license and right to make, use, sell, import and export XL647 and the related technology in the field of oncology (the "XL647 License"). The XL647 License requires the Company to make
	payments contingent on the achievement of certain development milestones (such as receiving certain government approvals and commencing certain clinical trials) and sales targets, totaling
	$379.4&nbsp;million. The XL647 License also includes single digit royalty payments commencing on the first commercial sale of any licensed product. No development milestones or sales were achieved
	as of March&nbsp;31, 2016 and December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
	October&nbsp;31, 2013, the Company and Symphony executed an additional amendment, whereby the deadline for commencement of the PKD trial was extended through 2014. At the time this
	extension was executed the Company paid an additional $1.0&nbsp;million in fees to Symphony. The Company was additionally obligated to pay Symphony $500,000 on or before January&nbsp;31, 2014 and
	$1.0&nbsp;million on or before May&nbsp;1, 2014. In February 2014, the Company paid $500,000 to settle the payment due on January&nbsp;31, 2014. On May&nbsp;1, 2014 the Company and Symphony
	executed an additional amendment to the amended and restated agreement, whereby the $1.0&nbsp;million payment due on May&nbsp;1, 2014 was extended to June&nbsp;1, 2014. This amendment increased
	the payment to $1.1&nbsp;million to include fees for deferral of the payment. These fees were recorded as research and development expense during 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	F-46
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	Kadmon Holdings,&nbsp;LLC and Subsidiaries
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Notes to consolidated financial statements (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	(unaudited as of March&nbsp;31, 2016 and for the three months ended March&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	10. License Agreements (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Symphony Evolution,&nbsp;Inc.
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On June&nbsp;11, 2014 the Company and Symphony executed an additional amendment to the amended and restated agreement, whereby the
	$1.1&nbsp;million payment due on June&nbsp;1, 2014 was extended to September&nbsp;30, 2014. This amendment increased the payment to $1.2&nbsp;million to include fees for deferral of the
	payment. The Company expensed $200,000 to research and development expense for these additional fees during 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
	September&nbsp;30, 2014 the Company and Symphony executed an additional amendment to the amended and restated agreement, whereby the $1.2&nbsp;million payment due on
	September&nbsp;30, 2014 was extended to November&nbsp;30, 2014. This amendment increased the payment to $1.4&nbsp;million to include fees for deferral of the payment. The Company expensed
	$200,000 to research and development expense for these additional fees during 2014. In November 2014, the Company made payment to Symphony for $1.4&nbsp;million in settlement of this obligation.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;All
	other contingent payments will be expensed as research and development as incurred.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Valeant Holdings International
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
<U>
	Infergen
</U>
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On January&nbsp;14, 2008, Kadmon Pharmaceuticals acquired the drug Infergen from Valeant Holdings International ("Valeant"). In
	connection with the acquisition of Kadmon Pharmaceuticals,&nbsp;LLC, formerly known as Three Rivers Pharmaceuticals,&nbsp;LLC in October 2010, the Company assumed a liability payable to Valeant,
	not contingent on the performance of the asset, of $6.9&nbsp;million. This liability was due in October 2013 and is recorded as other milestone payable on the Company's consolidated balance sheets.
	During 2014, two payments totaling $3.0&nbsp;million were made reducing this liability to $3.9&nbsp;million at December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014. During the three months ended March&nbsp;31,
	2016, this liability was settled as disclosed below.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Company discontinued sales of Infergen in the United States in September of 2013. On October&nbsp;23, 2013, the Company divested the worldwide property rights, intellectual
	property, and certain contracts and inventory to an unrelated party in exchange for future royalty streams in the event that the third party commercializes or sublicenses the product.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
<U>
	Syprine
</U>
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On February&nbsp;25, 2014, the Company entered into an agreement with Valeant for the co-promotion of
	Syprine
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	&reg;
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	,
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	a chelation therapy indicated in the treatment of patients with Wilson's disease who are intolerant of
	penicillamine. Under the agreement Valeant holds all marketing and distribution rights and responsibilities and the Company will co-promote Syprine through our existing sales force and commercial
	network. Valeant will pay the Company a co-promotion fee equal to 10% of Valeant's gross profit from the sale of Syprine, 50% of which must be used to pay down the Company's milestone payable and 50%
	of which may be used at the Company's discretion. At the time the other milestone payable has been satisfied in full, the entire co-promotion fee may be used at the Company's discretion.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;At
	the time the agreement was executed the Company had a liability payable to Valeant of $6.9&nbsp;million. The Company paid Valeant $1.5&nbsp;million of the other milestone payable
	and was required
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	F-47
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>

</A>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	Kadmon Holdings,&nbsp;LLC and Subsidiaries
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Notes to consolidated financial statements (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	(unaudited as of March&nbsp;31, 2016 and for the three months ended March&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	10. License Agreements (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	to
	pay an additional $1.5&nbsp;million of this obligation before December&nbsp;15, 2014. The Company made this payment in December 2014. The Company was required to satisfy the remaining balance
	of the other milestone payable of $3.9&nbsp;million if a defined liquidity or distribution event occurs. This is recorded as other milestone payable on the Company's consolidated balance sheets at
	December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	February 2016, the Company entered into a mutual termination agreement with Valeant. Upon termination, neither party shall have any rights or obligation including any and all past,
	present and future payments. Additionally, all rights and licenses granted under the agreement were immediately terminated and shall revert to the party granting such rights. As a result of the
	termination, the Company recorded a gain on settlement of the $3.9&nbsp;million other milestone payable to Valeant during the first three months of March&nbsp;31, 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Vivus,&nbsp;Inc.
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
<U>
	Qsymia&reg;
</U>
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In June 2015, the Company entered into an agreement with Vivus for the co-promotion of
	Qsymia
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	&reg;
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	,
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	a combination of phentermine and topiramate extended-release indicated as an adjunct to a reduced-calorie
	diet and increased physical activity for chronic weight management in adults. Under the agreement Vivus holds all marketing and distribution rights and responsibilities and the Company will co-promote
	Qsymia
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	&reg;
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	through its existing sales force and commercial network. Vivus will pay the Company a co-promotion fee equal to 40% of Vivus' per
	prescription net revenue for each prescription filled of Qsymia
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	&reg;
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	by the Company. No meaningful revenue has been generated from this
	agreement as of March&nbsp;31, 2016 and December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Princeton University
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On December&nbsp;8, 2010, the Company entered into a license agreement with Princeton University ("Princeton") whereby the Company
	obtained from Princeton a worldwide exclusive license and right to make, use and sell products identified by Princeton's Flux technology ("Princeton License"). The Company is obligated to pay
	Princeton an annual license fee of $60,000, which is recorded as research and development expense. In addition, the Princeton License requires the Company to make payments contingent on the
	achievement of certain development milestones totaling $31.0&nbsp;million, such as receiving certain government approvals. Upon commercial sale, the Company is obligated to pay a low single digit
	royalty based on net sales levels. No development milestones or sales were achieved as of March&nbsp;31, 2016 and December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	MeiraGTx&nbsp;Ltd.
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company formed Kadmon Gene Therapy,&nbsp;LLC ("KGT") in October 2014, a Delaware limited liability company and wholly-owned
	subsidiary of the Company. The Company obtained Board approval to contribute certain of its gene therapy-related assets to KGT. The Company's lenders approved this asset contribution and agreed to
	release these assets from the lien of the Second Amended and Restated Convertible Credit Agreement and the Third Amended Credit Agreement upon KGT raising $5.0&nbsp;million in equity capital from
	third parties. As of April 2015, KGT raised $6.6&nbsp;million in equity subscription proceeds.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	F-48
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>

<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=282,EFW="2229263",CP="KADMON HOLDINGS, LLC",DN="1",CHK=732311,FOLIO='F-48',FILE='DISK134:[15ZCV1.15ZCV70901]FU70901A.;19',USER='PJAMES',CD='18-JUL-2016;18:05' -->
<A NAME="A2229263ZS-1A_HTM_PAGE_FU70901_1_49">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2229263ZS-1A_HTM_BG70901A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	Kadmon Holdings,&nbsp;LLC and Subsidiaries
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Notes to consolidated financial statements (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	(unaudited as of March&nbsp;31, 2016 and for the three months ended March&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	10. License Agreements (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	April 2015, the Company executed several agreements which transferred the Company's ownership of KGT to MeiraGTx Limited ("MeiraGTx"), a wholly-owned subsidiary of the Company. As
	part of these agreements, the Company also transferred various property rights, employees and management tied to the ongoing development of the intellectual property and contracts identified in the
	agreements to MeiraGTx. At a later date, MeiraGTx ratified its shareholder agreement and accepted the pending equity subscription agreements, which provided equity ownership to various parties. The
	execution of these agreements resulted in a 48% ownership in MeiraGTx by the Company. The Company's investment is being accounted for under the equity method at zero cost and an estimated fair value
	at the time of the transaction of $24.0&nbsp;million. This value was determined based upon the implied value established by the cash raised by MeiraGTx in exchange for equity interests by third
	parties. The Company is represented on the Board of Managers of MeiraGTx and is a party to decisions which influence the direction of the organization.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Company has assessed the applicability of ASC 810 after the execution of the aforementioned agreements and based on the corporate structure, voting rights and contributions of the
	various parties in connection with these agreements, determined that MeiraGTx is a variable interest entity, however consolidation is not required as the Company is not the primary beneficiary based
	upon the voting and managerial structure of the entity. The Company accounted for its investment in MeiraGTx using the equity method. After MeiraGTx is deconsolidated or derecognized, any retained
	ownership interest is initially recognized at fair value and a gain or loss is recognized. The Company recognized a gain of $24.0&nbsp;million based on the fair value of this equity investment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;MeiraGTx,
	a limited company organized under the laws of England and Wales, was established to focus on the development of novel gene therapy treatments for a range of inherited and
	acquired disorders. MeiraGTx plans to develop therapies for ocular diseases, including rare inherited blindness, as well as xerostomia following radiation treatment for head and neck cancer. MeiraGTx
	is also developing an innovative gene regulation platform that has the potential to expand the way that gene therapy can be applied, creating a new paradigm for biologic therapeutics in the
	biopharmaceutical industry.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This
	summarized financial information for MeiraGTx as of and for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 is as follows (amounts in thousands):
</FONT>
</P>
